pros: Flexibility. The car package is decent. Good foundation for future positions in outside sales.
cons: This company is perfect for building your skills/resume in outside sales and leveraging it into your next position. If you’re coming to this company looking for it to be a long term career or if you’re an experienced sales professional, you really need to look elsewhere. Their management trainee program allows newly college graduates with NO sales experience to be looped into a sales rotation, which ultimately means less territory for the people who actually choose sales as a career and have invested the time into it. The environment can be toxic and you are not treated as a professional, you’re almost treated as a student that needs constant supervision. Men are not even trusted enough in this company to grow beards, that clearly says a lot. Sales and Service are constantly pitted against one another which makes it a difficulty for either to do their jobs effectively. Promotions and strong territories are given to those who golf with their managers on the weekends and everyone is aware of it.

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Sacramento, CA
pros: Cintas, for now 2013 has very good health benefits and starts you out at $16.00 an hour till you get your own route, then your on commission. After about 4 years I was making about 40k a years, not the best!
cons: Cintas likes to force high KPI numbers and quotas "numbers" on its employees. Its also a very gross job as you pick up dirty towels ect... all day. If you live in a hot area you may not want this gig as it gets 20 degrees hotter in your work truck. You also have to attend a weekly meeting about 5:30 am to go over the locations various CONTEST like selling more products to your customers. Oh ya and you'll be ask to role play in front of everyone at these meetings too. I would have to say the worst part about Cintas is the pay structure. Route volume pay = 1st $6000 you get 10%-----$6001 to $8000 you get 4%-----$8001 to $10000 you get 2%......In other words the more you work the less you get paid, so a smaller route makes more sense!!

review_title: A "put your head down and do your work" kind of place
pros: Great benefits, fair pay, good work life balance
cons:
Culture, dresscode, technology, attitude. The list goes on...
You cannot will a good culture into existence just by talking about it. That seems to be the Cintas method. Talk. Talk. Talk. But where is it? The culture in the department I worked in was a joke. I was barely involved in the actual work. I was given administrative tasks. My exit interview consisted of multiple choice questions about why I was leaving and true/false questions. I was able to elaborate but I doubt that even gets read. Once I completed my exit interview my bosses did not speak to me. I was already approved for a week of PTO on my 1st week out of my 2 week notice. In the meeting where I told my boss I was putting in my two weeks I said I understood if I was unable to take my PTO anymore. I was told that I could still take the PTO. Manager tried to convince me to stay but when I still put my 2 week notice in writing on their desk, I was told I could no longer take my PTO. 

In the beginning of COVID-19 they drug their feet in making the decision to work from home. They do not value their employees. The cubicles are horribly outdated. Packed in as much as possible. Outdated chairs. Terribly monitors (if you're lucky to get more than just one). Will not pay for software needed to compete job effectively.

review_title: The good, the bad, and the ugly
pros:
Reasonable benefits package
Insurance is not too expensive.  Cost did not go up this past year.
The company makes money and is profitable. Cintas stock continues to be on the up rise and shareholders are happy.
cons:
Serious "class" system in the Corporate office in Mason, OH.
Poor time off benefit for salaried partners. Partners have to work an entire year before they earn a day off.  In order to get a day off before then, they have to take it without pay or take comp time.
If you have a good department and manager, then you will probably do fine.
COO pitches a fit if you cross your arms while you are in a meeting. He is personally offended if you cross your arms or clasp your hands because he thinks it is disrespectful. He will call you out on it.
Insane corporate policies. Cannot eat lunch at your desk. Cups must always have a lid. Cannot sit in your car to eat your lunch or take a call.
To read and understand all of the Corporate policies would take all of your time.
Company pushes partners to contribute to their pet projects. Company does support good projects like Clothe the Kids and Matt 25 ministries, but to ask partners to contribute to these creates a hardship. Many Distribution Center partners need public assistance to get by.
Distribution Center Purchase orders have to be written by hand. Yes, I did say by hand.

pros: CIntas is very good company to work for. Managment in Tulsa is very good, I am always excited about going to work every day. I work 4 days a week giving me 3 days with my family. I like the rewards SSr's recieve- it is based off performance, so people who are complaining maybe you don't need to be in sales, it takes back bone, confidence, and effort. Pay is great, better than most people who have college degrees. Great place for advancement, and wonderful benefits- I am glad that I can't blame the economy on my lack of sales because- that would just be a dumb excuse. I apperciate the managments in Tulsa they are always loyal, honest, and hard working- thanks guys!
cons: No cons, just think each company has it's kinks but time proves all things. Look at the track record of Cintas, it show s the quality of our service and sales, and it is good! There is not much training in the direction of sales, like role play, and closing customers, and such for SSR's

pros: Easy to get a job here. The culture is great for you and your coworkers. Everyone is friendly with each other and willing to help. Casual Fridays and frequent location outings help keep moral up in a stressful industry.
cons:
Start with 1 week of PTO, 20% 401k matching, however medical insurance is affordable. 
Pay is below average and there is little opportunity for advancement or for a raise. Annual merit increases are given at 2%-4%. 
Cintas resists modern workplace benefits like casual dress, remote working, paternity leave, PTO, etc. With the recent COVID-19 outbreak, Cintas had no plan in place for the safety of their employees. The Director told us he had no plan and that working from home is not an option but employees could use PTO if they want to stay home. If the building is closed (even for city/state mandated emergencies) the only option for payment is using PTO. We had to close during a hurricane and employees were told they should stay home but were not paid.  One year on Christmas Eve, the location closed (no option to come in to work) but employees had to make up their hours. 
We took a company wide survey for all employees where 93% of employees said they feel their pay is not competitive or fair but no change was made.

pros: Pay is ok as well as the health benefits. You make more money IF and only you sell more catalog, gloves and such. Work only 4 days a week

Ethics are horrible if a customer goes outta business the managers push on pushing that invoice through to charge the customer on service they wont receive stating that oh thats or last weeks service when really thats the currents bill. A shirt may be 5 yrs old andd they want you to L/R the customer if they stop that employee.. Really if you kept a shirt for that long how would it look especially laundering once a week in heavy soil wash when the clothes are meant to be worn out cause hello we service the work industry. Also if a manager screws up they try to blame the ssr for it especially when a customer tries to quit they push the SSR to try to save the customer without lowering prices or if you try your hardest and you tell them they still want to quit, the manager does nothing and blames you for it. All they care is about your numbers never recognize hard work of the Skippers only scold them. Recently theyre trying to add lost business for your numbers so now customers that go out of business affects our numbers, what a cruel way to play with the SSR.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros: The pros i will talk about are from the position, not from the company. Its a great position, you get to have a different job site everyday. You see things in the area you live and inside buildings you would have never seen before. You get to work outside, and not at a desk.
cons: This company is just another "fake it till you make it" organization. They're salary from worker to worker makes zero sense, they hire and pay out of need, not out of experience and talent. They have zero training, or close to it. They expect all training to come from senior technicians, but sometimes the senior technicians were trained by people that didn't know what they were doing. There is alot of drama in the office, and their policies are illegal regarding drive time. Their technology is way behind the curve, and puts alot of pressure on the tech to finish all required tasks in an 8 hour day. Work life balance is very poor. Very unorganized business practices from the top down... its all numbers and has nothing to do with the fire industry. Just a bunch of office workers talking about stuff they do not know about.

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Traverse City, MI
pros: good benefits, 4 day work week, no weekends, great coworkers
cons:
Horrible company. In a typical day, you reach the plant between 430 and 530 in the morning. The Plant is always short product and you are forced to try to make it back to customers later on in the week to service them if you could not service them on their delivery date, if not just run it thru and hope they don’t notice is what you are told. 
Management is horrible. No one wants to help you. They sit on their butts all day crunching numbers, waiting for you to get back off route to tell you what you doing wrong. Won't assist you if you're in need of help.
If you want to get a bonus, which is about 500 extra a month, you have to re-sign customer to 5-year service agreements, which many customers refuse to sign because their prices are outrageous.
The hours are long. Some routes, the well established ones, having less stops on them to finish fairly early, between 12 and 1 pm. The others, those having between 25 t 50 stops per day, finish between 4 and 5pm.
There is no opportunity for advancement, unless you are a person with low ethical standards and even then they will hire externally versus internally.
This is a very difficult place to work. Too many procedures put into place by management that are unethical. Management does have it's favorites and they are compensated handsomely with high paying routes. Other drivers are given routes that make no more than 35 to 40 thousand dollars per year

pros: The people I work with are great. You get to meet many customers and that's what I enjoy most. I talk to people and have fun throughout the day. The pay is decent. I started at about 35k and my route was built up, through me and with the help of management, to around 50k. I don't see much room for growth though because my week is 40 hours and they won't let you go much over that. I like my service manager He understands issues and does his best to help. Great benefits. Can make your own hours.
cons: It's hard work and certainly not for everyone. I change about 300-400 floor mats a week along with delivering towels, chemicals, paper products, and uniforms. The big shots are always trying to squeeze more and more out of the ssr. We handle all price increase negotiations (1 or more yearly), are required to get customers to sign a completely 1-sided 5 year service contract, do two 15 minute truck inspections daily, deal with and explain constant product shortages to customers, and put out lots of other fires. They are always on us about something (do this training, sell more catalog, sample this or that, get renewals, etc). All this on top of the exhausting work. Then after you work your tail off to get done, they often make you wait around to get checked in. There is a big disconnect between the people that actually do the work and the people that decide what those workers do.

cons: If I could add red warning flash lights to this comment I would - beware, beware, beware!!! If anything seems too good to be true, if something doesn't add up, or if something 1 single red flag is being raised - run for your life!!! I mean that. Any positive comments about this company are placed by HR as PR work only. Everybody hates working for this company and anybody who says they do is a phoney, fraud & a hypocrite. You will hate your life, you will hate your job, this is anything but a career, you will never in your professional or personal life ever feel so mistreated, used, overworked, underpaid, gossiped about, backstabbed, etc... and there isn't a single person you can go to for any support or assistance. If you do ever go to anybody for anything they will twist and distort it. You will never live through so much backstabbing, lying, manipulation. You will be pushed and provoked, you will have work thrown at you literally, and you will be mocked and ridiculed. If anybody reading this thinks this is an individual having a bad day, not in the least, just somebody who's lived it and it cautioning anybody who is needing and wanting a job and will do just about anything to get one, this is not it! If you have any self worth, dignity or respect you will not apply for or accept a job at this godforsaken place. Just be careful and take a good look around your surroundings and who is saying what when you go into this place. You can't say you weren't warned!

review_title: Great for early rising, physical hustlers
pros:
-You can get/stay in shape. Physical, active job. On your feet all day, lifting, carrying, loading, unloading etc. 
-4 day work weeks
-Fun culture and coworkers
-high quality management and leadership
-independence - generally no one is looking over your shoulder all day
-customers may offer you food/meals (depends on the route and your relationship with your customers but you could potentially get 3 free meals a day if you wanted)
cons:
-You will be in "training" (SSRT) for at least 2-6 months where you will earn $17 an hour. 
-As an SSR, your pre tax annual income will range approximately between 35k (low performer) to a max of 55k (top performer). Whether youve been there 2 years or 20 years. 
-Very little opportunity for upward mobility in company. Not many avenues exist. 
-early work days (430-630am depending on route)
-must work in the elements, rain, snow, heat etc)
-minimal vacation time.
-many trucks are in poor condition including many without functioning A/C. I felt unsafe in several trucks. 
-trucks are heavily roach infested. 
-you will most likely have to sort through dirty kitchen laundry filled with maggots, especially in the warm months.

pros: The work itself is cake for anyone who's used to physical labor thats simple and the pay compensation and work life balance.
cons: Ill keep it simple, its a frequent for managers and supervisors and hr personnel to alter your money based on what they want. If you work an extra day on your off day its $150. Ssrs often need to confront management about pay issues its a lawsuit waiting to happen.

pros: Good pay and lots of benefits
cons: Things move often and you don’t get much say

pros: Car package is great. Especially not paying for gas.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Lawrenceville, GA

review_title: Sales Manager's dropping like flies in the NW & CPG's!!!!
pros: Company used to be a great place to start a sales career. Good training, opportunities and room for growth. Be ready to work hard, be micro managed and get crushed on the phones or during your cold calls. If you can make it through the first year and then make a PC you'll be in a great spot to have a great looking resume. Some decent partners on the operations/service side.
cons: Sr. Sales Director and his other 2 directors are negatively impacting the region. Lost several experienced sales reps and some good sales managers recently. They are reducing several locations from 2 sales managers down to 1 (no more promotion opportunities). Others have left because the culture has changed so much in the last 6 months. Sr. Sales Director is all about the hustle and hitting activity numbers, has no people skills (probably why so many people have left in the last 3 months) and he lacks executive leadership skills. Tough to build a good sales culture when you can't relate to your front-line reps.

pros: Good people with a positive and strong corporate culture, opportunity to see and work in different areas of the business, opportunity to build on transferable skills, exposure to high level executives with the chance to talk/interact so that you don’t just feel like another cog in the machine.
cons: Before you accept this position, please ask what you will be doing on a day to day basis in each rotation. As an MT, one would assume being put in a corporate environment and doing tasks/duties related to the title. However, many rotations are VERY manual labor intensive and you will legitimately be sweating in the warehouse and lifting boxes. As someone who graduated with a college degree, I felt this was unnecessary and frustrating. Additionally, the program lacks any real structure and you will find yourself with a lot of down time and when you ask for work, it will be meaningless grunt tasks such as ordering coffee for the office or filing invoices. MTs are also ineligible to earn commission when they are doing the exact same work as the regular partners in each rotation.

pros: The people is what makes this company great to work for.  The pay was decent and car package was decent as well.
cons: This quote from office space comes to mind all the time "do you know I have 8 bosses?"  As a manager having literally 5 bosses and being micromanaged while micromanaging your SSR,'s was exhausting.  At Cintas it was a different flavor of week, we need net billings high but don't have products to give to the customer, don't give credits though.  We never had products in the warehouse which nobody cared because they don't have to deal with the customer.  Then you have to worry about your customers quitting mid term because they cannot afford the weekly $300 invoice, which Cintas will take them to court.  On top of losing them your bonus will get cut and get scolded from your 5 bosses you are not micromanaging the business.  Nothing like getting a text at 3am that your SSR can't show up to work and you having to jump on route while managing 8 other SSR's.  I moved on from Cintas and doing pretty well as a service director, which I do owe Cintas as improving my management skills.  I do cringe every time I walk into a business and see a Cintas product or any uniform products I think of how hard it was to get that product down.  Long work week, typically 6 to 5, looked down upon if you leave before that.

Customers who are not told what they are signing and the length in which they are signing for, so when they wanna quit, its O, im sorry, you still have three years with us, arent you glad you signed a 60 month agreement for shop towels and a mop. 3. They want you to spend your time outside of working running specials to all these accounts. It truly is hard to run an ethical route and keep your customers happy.  We are supposed to gain rational and emotional trust with our customers, but I truly believe we are to do this, only so we can increase there prices as much as we can.  I sometimes feel sick pulling into my accounts

job_title: Software Engineer I in Mason, OH
pros: The only good thing I can say about Cintas is you have job security because they won't fire anyone unless you're directly responsible for the company losing millions of dollars.
cons: I worked in IT and the so called " leadership" of the department was a complete joke. The entire "leadership" rank is beyond 100% incompetent & consistently threw their people under the bus to save face with the executives. The IT department is nothing more than a group of order takers. Essentially a bunch of over educated & over paid waiters wasting everything away. You will not be challenged at Cintas and you will not be able to make a difference or change anything. New ideas are laughed at and you are put down for mentioning them. For the most part, the people in IT are great to work with, but they're all burnt out & just riding it out. It's so depressing seeing so much wasted potential, but, for whatever reason, people don't leave. The pay is terrible for what you have to put up with and the benefits are nothing to write home about and essentially the bare minimum. Cintas will not invest in you and you will not be able to advance your career there. I'd avoid this place like the plague. However, if you enjoy wearing a shirt & tie to work, being belittled by "leadership" & business contacts, & only being required to warm a seat from 8-5 then this is the place for you. This was nothing more than a 4 year waste of my career.

review_title: There are better jobs for the money.
pros: Stability, training, benefits, profit sharing, and
cons:
As a Cintas Service Sales rep you have great expectations placed on you.  Your family life, your health, and the health of your family mean nothing to the leadership team.  Most of the managers will not leave their office to help one of their team if the situation calls for it.  Management is allowed to be lazy and unmotivated, while at the same time punishing or redirecting team members they feel are "slipping."  
You are considered a route manager but also have to drive a truck (often in poor repair), over strain yourself physically to try to get your day done in a reasonable amount of time, and ensure your customers remain happy with, and loyal to, Cintas.  And also there are a multitude of long unnecessary meetings you do not get paid to attend.
I've found their are many opportunities in the market to be a territory account manager for the same pay without the hassle of also being a "mat flipper".  Why you would stay at Cintas for any length of time as an SSR baffles me.

pros: You get a lot of front line experience and can definitely relate to your employees, because you've literally walked a mile in their shoes.  If you are a favorite of upper management, you will go far, as they tend to promote their proteges.  As long as you are willing to work tireless hours, for zero thanks, it's a great company to work for.  They are definitely an equal opportunity employer.  Unless you are white, and then they'll have to hire a minority to make their quota, even if you were the best candidate.
cons: You will never see your family.  If you are a male in management, you better make sure your spouse wants to stay home and take care of everything around the house, because you won't be there to do it.  And if you're a female, don't even bother getting married or having kids.  You won't see them.  You can expect early mornings and late evenings and Saturdays.  If you aren't part of the "chosen" you won't get promoted, even if you work your tail off.  Also "thank you" is not a word in their vocabulary.  Expect to give it your all and only get a "what are you going to do next."  It's mental and emotional abuse at it's finest.  Like a bad boyfriend that you keep going back to.

review_title: Have a strong work ethic with interpersonal skills and you will excel.
job_title: Service Sales Representative in Hayward, CA
pros:
If you have a strong work ethic and interpersonal skills, you will excel.  They expect you to work a full eight hour day, but many employees would get away with starting around 8am and completing their day by 3pm.  

You start between 40-50k for a potential 33-35 hour work week.

If you are in the first aid and safety division, the company provides a gas card intended for the utility van that you are allowed to use for your field work and the commute to and from work.  The company also provides $25 for your cell phone bill if you include your number on your business card.
cons:
Considering you are by yourself in a van/truck all day and doing the same physical task over and over again, the repetitiveness of the position can be more tiresome than other jobs.  

Depending on which branch you are employed at, management style strongly varies.  I was fortunate enough not to be micro managed, but I hear branches throughout the company are notorious for it.

Many of the clients will be very condescending and treat you as a "service monkey" with a stereotypical background similar to a janitor.  This obstacle can be overcome with an abundance of patience, strong interpersonal skills, and a positive attitude.

review_title: Great for your Resume if you can live with being treated like excrement!
job_title: Pro-Active Sales Trainer in Branford, CT
pros: It's another great company to have on your resume, they have great notariaty and are  a good work ethic standard! The Blue collar Guys and Gals delivering the uniforms mats and towels are a great group of people!
cons: Upper level Management was devious and manipulative, Location philosophy was "Take care of Cintas now and they will take care of you in the future" . I moved up the ladder from a Sales Service Rep. to a Sales Trainer. so I bought into the philosophy for a little while untill I saw what really was happing at the location behind close doors. The desire to have Family Men and Women work at the location wasn't for the atmosphere as much as it was for entrapment. They bring new meaning to getting blood from a stone. I was put in harms way a number of times while picking up and delivering materials to clients due to the lack of communication and ethics of sales manangement. 5am Meetings 3 days a week and your expected to stay till the last bell tolls. I saw my Wife and kids less than any other job I had, and say good by social life!

review_title: Great company that unfortunately unknowingly does not invest in its employees the way that they should.
job_title: Sales Representative in Vernon Hills, IL
pros: I was always busy. At the time that I was working there, Cintas was beginning or in the middle of expanding. They had the leads already in your desk in the morning encouraging you to be the sales specialist that set up the interviews to enable them to close on a sale.
cons: Cintas did not pay anyone from the housekeepers to I am sure the Vice President of Cintas, any sort of money and benefits that a family could survive on. Unfortunately, I think that when the representative hired me and started telling me about the benefits, he told me I had to wait 90 days   for them to begin. And, above all, an employee that thinks they are going to get the usual benefit package after waiting 90 days, when someone in your family becomes sick or you need medicine, dental work, even scarier, someone being hospitalized, the family will within about a months time, receive the "Benefits" in the mail. I mean that a bill demonstrating that you actually were paying about 85% of your insurance and all costs that unfortunately you just incurred.  So, you in fact were never receiving benefits at Cintas, you were receiving lies and accumulation of bills. Hopefully, they didn't ruin your life.

pros: Cintas bought out, g & k in Santa Fe springs, ever since then my grandmother states it’s not as good of a place now. Cintas doesn’t value their employees

review_title: Very dirty unethical and dirty business
pros: Great on going training and it guides you to be a good B2B closer
cons:
Very unethical business. Cintas purposely shorten the quantity of service that customers agreed to pay on weekly business. They forced customers to sign a 5 year contract but always raise their service fees and prices during the contract term. Not only that, they seldomly replace the floor mats. Customers pay weekly service to have a fresh clean floor mats. What Cintas does, the drivers will roll the mats out of the customer's building, then they pretend to grab a fresh clean mats from their truck but only to bring in the same old and dirty mats back inside. Additionally the GM and plant managers from each distribution mandate to each truck only be filled at a maximum of 80% of the actuall inventory. Needless to say, none of the customers get a 100% of what they are paying for their weekly service. However, when customers realized that they are short with their bar towels or aprons and etc, Cintas will be more than happy to increase the quantity and charge them with more money. Can sales reps make money?  Absolutely. Good reps can make somewhere between $90-$120k a year. Average rep about $70-85k a year. HOWEVER, can they sleep at night for knowing they cheated their customers on daily basis???  
Another thing, the management people. They are very micromanage. They are super anal with how many dials do you make during "phone blocks". How many appointments a week do you secured. And they never satisfy at your accomplishments. It's never enough at Cintas.

pros: Great Benefits, Good hours, m-f, days only, Nice people, Lots of training, Company Van to take home.
cons: Enough is never enough, Pay hit a downward spiral, Everything constantly changing so as soon as you get it down they want you to do it a different way.  They lost concern for the customer and now are all about hitting numbers and the shareholder.  Conflicting, both sides of their mouth instructions.  One day they preach "take care of the customer, don't lose the customer" and the next day you are reprimanded for not hitting goals or pushing something on a customer they do not need.  Breadcrumb tracking radar device on vans, no trust and they question every move you make.  Bye Bye flexibility.

review_title: Great Culture, Decent Benefits, Bad Management
job_title: SAP AR Coordinator in Irving, TX
pros:
The culture is based on performance, professionalism, positive discontent, and ethical standards. If you are a motived, good character, Cintas has a great culture.

The benefits and pay are average compared to most mid-sized corporations.
cons:
Management isn't up to par with competing companies. Cintas is an ever changing environment and Management tends to try things that don't work over and over hoping for a different result. 

I was promised a monthly bonus and promotion based on performance which I got for a limited time. I was promoted once, but the bonuses were taken away.

Cintas says that they don't do affirmative action in training, but their managers say differently. They make it clear that they need to have a diverse environment so if you aren't the right color or age of the person who left the before you, you probably won't get promoted to their position. If your a minority, I would strongly recommend this company.

review_title: Can Be Rewarding, But It Will Be Earned
job_title: Service Supervisor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good benefits. SSR pay is good depending on the location and the route you may get.  Internal promotion is usually considered first, but from here on out better make sure you have a college education or you won't get past the supervisor level.  Strong company, no fear of outsourcing here.  Good return on 401K profit sharing.
cons: The hours, especially in management are extremely difficult.  No work life balance.  Company agendas always change and so do the bonus structures all the way down to the SSR level which can be extremely frustrating.  Communication from Corporate and throughout the location level is extremely poor.  Expectations are set unreasonably high and management partners are given sometimes 2 or more full time jobs but expected to perform flawlessly.  Corporate management is extremely out of touch with location realities and the location GM's know this and consistently hide behind false promises and half truths to appease the higher ups.  Engagement and ESP visits are more of a witch hunt than actually trying to help locations or improve employee moral.

pros: Great training. Strong management program
cons: Micro managing for new associates.

review_title: Good partners, Improve Transparency, Get with the Times
pros: The co-workers (partners) are really good, the salary is decent, the commission multipliers are solid, and the training is pretty sound.
cons:
The mandatory in person phone block is not productive to success. Employees just end up sitting there not being productive when they can call from another location. The shirt and tie dress code is also antiquated in 2020, no one actually dresses like this when they are in the field. It’s difficult to sell certain accounts because there always seems to be some Multiple Account Manager who is selling that industry. 

There are huge divisions between the plant workers who are forced to wear blue collar shirts and the sales reps who are forced to wear shirt and ties. This forced difference, creates a mass class differences between the two.

The sales process itself, much like the company is antiquated: People don’t need to do anything in person, meetings can be done virtually, the process is stuck in the 80s. Also, there is always talk about essential work and safe jobs, this company will cut you loose without warning. Also, they increase prices on their customers without any warning and you can forget about compensated meals when you’re on the road: Company is so cheap, the corporate card is useless.

pros: love it there, such a great career to have and be a part of

review_title: Cintas is a great stepping stone job and resume builder if you can handle the stress of high sales activity.
pros: You will get exceptional benefits at Cintas. Also, in sales their expense reimbursement is pretty good.  Car allowance...etc  If you are a male you will stand a pretty good chance for advancement.  A lot of females here just will not be hired on as managers.
cons: Some of the downsides of Cintas...spartan company.  They will do anything to benefit Cintas. Although give you good benefits and pay decent there will be things that will make this job short lived.  Their sales activity required is just ridiculous.  They require you to do so much as a sales rep that it will send you onto the next job rather quickly.  This is definitely is a stepping stone job, and will be a great resume builder for anyone's future.

pros: The base pay is pretty good, service management is very supportive, several health benefits to choose from, and routes are all four days. This company is tops in terms of uniform and facility service providers.
cons:
The three days off are great, but those four days on is work, shower, sleep if you're the kind of person that likes to sleep.

Depending on the route you may have to work 12+ hours in a work day to maintain a great route in management's eyes. In addition to taking care of existing customers (that's 40 hours in itself), the SSR is expected to sell catalog products, fight for yearly price increases, get customers to maintain 60 month service agreements, actively look for viable leads for new business, keep lost replacement charges up, keep material costs down, etc. If the SSR isn't passionate about this line of work, it can wear said individual down very quickly. Any overtime is not time and a half, but half time. 

This may be just a flaw of the rental industry in general, but inconsistenties that occur in production can lead to many issues for the SSR. 

I'm just trying to tell it as I see it, and the grind wasn't worth it to me.

job_title: Management Trainee Program in Detroit, MI
pros:
Lots of experience in lots of areas. Most people are really nice. You are the golden child as an MT, they put a lot into you so they will do their best to keep you.
Going through the MT program sets you up to be very marketable even outside of Cintas after you’re done! So if you take the job, just at least make it through the program before leaving.
cons:
The best way to be promoted is to bit your numbers, drink allllll the corporate kool aid and kiss peoples butts. It doesn’t matter if you are known for being rude and self centered. As long as you hit your goals for a long enough time and tell enough higher ups you want to get promoted, you will. This is why there are a lot of bad managers.
Favoritism is a thing - due to COVID they had cuts. Cintas let their true colors out by firing certain people. Those that had friends coming into the job stayed over people just as good. And people who made higher bases due to being brought over from an acquisition got fired even though their counterpart hadn’t been hitting goals for months.

review_title: If you're not in the in circle, count your days.

cons: No support, your title is irrelevant to the company. Your ideas and opinions aren't appreciated.

Employees in dept are more concerned about gossiping behind your back than being mature and working with you as a team. They work you hard but then constantly berate you every time you’re away from your desk - even to go to the bathroom!! Unfortunately you can’t trust anyone in that dept. It’s constant stress and I would never recommend anyone work there that wants a job they enjoy.

review_title: Low pay, hot environment, corporate heavy
pros: Regular schedule, no forced overtime

pros: I am really at a lose of words for the best reasons to work at Cintas.  I guess the 401K option is good, but they don't pay the plant workers enough to be able to invest.
cons: Employees have just lost their normal hourly pay.  They placed us on a "incentive program" to make "more money".  But the truth of the matter is that they royally screwed us.  They raised our production numbers so high that we can't even hang the amount needed to continue making the same pay.  We won't be making more because they dropped the base pay to barely over minimum wage.  And they think we should be happy about this.  I don't know how they can sleep at night!!!  They also lie to their clients.  They charge extra for pressing clothes, but they don't press half of the garments that we're supposed to.  We hang soured garments all day, and they don't fix half the repairs that we find.  I don't even know why we're supposed to look for them.   I wouldn't recommend this company to future employees or clients.

pros: Benefits are good and partners are pleasant
cons: Maintenance partners are poorly paid for all the responsibilities they have and the workload they get. To top it all, the supposedly safety measures introduced make it difficult to get the work done quickly and efficiently. Most are more afraid of getting terminated for not being 100% correct with LOTO procedures than not being able to do the work. We are probably the only company in the world that requires long sleeve shirts, safety glasses and hearing protection in order to turn on lights in the building. Cintas is more concerned about fines than employees working conditions. Salaried partners are abused by having to work long hours to reach goals. The longer hours result in salaried partners getting less pay per hour than hourly partners. Supervisors are the worst off having extreme responsibilities and very little recognition for the work they do. Increases in pay are pathetic. A long term employee getting maximum increases over a few years ends up getting less pay than new hires.

pros: 40 hour work week with weekends off.
cons:
The pay is ridiculously low while the demands are high. I switched positions 2 months ago but I'm not even making what the position starts at. I'm expected to take over for other people, also with higher paying jobs, on a regular basis. Very little incentive to perform based on this alone.

Drivers at this location are rude, get in the way, make messes for others and still expect your help. I guess a sense of entitlement comes with the uniform.

In safety champion meetings, employees are encouraged to take matters with co-workers into their own hands. Management doesn't want to deal with that part of their job. In response to a comment made that not everyone was doing their morning stretches, the floor manager actually said "Legally we can't make them do the stretches, but we can peer pressure them into it."

The friendly facade wears thin but you can count on management dropping it whenever there's an opportunity to speak to you in a condescending tone. Which happens often. When the corporate people come in, they speak to the employees as though they're in kindergarten. It's embarrassing and demeaning.

Not enough time is given off for major holidays.

review_title: Run, run away from Cintas now.
pros: If you want to benchmark against the worst treatment possible this is the place to go.  While working a booth at a job fair, after I left Cintas I spoke with a fellow recruiter who also had worked for Cintas.  One thing to remember especially military members because Cintas aggressively recruits former NCOs and junior officers is if you paid any attention to ethics training or showed any concern for your troops this is not the place for you.  Become a prison guard for the state of California, you will be paid better and the convicts will respect you more than Cintas management will.
cons: Petty treatment, moronic work rules, martinets in management and stinginess beyond compare.  In addition, if you seek any intelligent conversation beyond last night's ball game you are out of luck.  At a company function an executive was asked, "Why does not Cintas provide tuition assistance"?  The answer given was if we paid college tuition how could we say no to someone who wanted to study horticulture compared to someone who wanted to study business.  Easy, Cintas has more rules that any firm I have ever worked for.  Create a rule that says we only pay college tuition for majors that relate to our business, i.e. industrial engineering, accounting, HR whatever.  Instead, Cintas chose to treat the people in the room as if we all had lobotomies.  I got away from Cintas as soon as something better came along.

review_title: Run, as fast as you can.
job_title: Service Sales Representative in Lawrenceville, GA
pros: Sales training was outstanding but bordered unethical. Get some experience with this fortune 550 company and take it to a more ethical company who cares about their employees as well as their customers. Work/Life balance was decent at first but has all but completely gone away.
cons: They set you up for short term success. They pride themselves on pushing a customer to their limits until the customer tires out and eventually cuts the cord. The company completely lacks values as well as morals. They are cut throat and lack any ethics what so ever. I've seen them run employees into the ground and fire 20 year employees without reason other then replacing them with a cheaper and younger employee. They make you work harder for less money each year. This company actually trained me to mislead customers into thinking that our bundled service provides a discount under the illusion of a two year contract that never existed.This obviously left our customers feeling trapped and unable to cancel service. With the sales force that Cintas has behind each service employee, they aren't afraid to have a customer cancel knowing that a new one is right around the corner.This is a recipe for disaster.

pros: Was hired in when the plant first opened for production.  The GM was fantastic but than we got a new GM and things changed.  The plant was now in it's fifth year and it appeared that they were trying to get rid of people who had been there the longest.  It worked !
cons: Mandatory overtime at the end of my five year employment with the company.  Management didn't hire in enough people or temps to help with the work after we had bought out another company.  Lots of chaos and stress.  Maybe things are better now but I would never go back.  Management said that our raises were based on work performance but were really based on how many days we missed.  Work reviews were rarely given on time - thereby delaying any raise that we might be receiving.  I think the lowest raise other than nothing was that someone got a 3 cent raise while I was there, which to me was a message from the company - a slap in the face.  Nothing would have been better rather than getting 3 cents.  I left the company in 2006 and never looked back.

pros: I can't think of any.
cons: I regret taking this job. The interview process was lengthy and very involved. I have been working here for 4 months and have been seeking employment outside of Cintas for three months. I don;t want to make the same mistake twice. I am extremely disappointed in this company.

review_title: Great Place to Start a Sales Career
pros: Cintas will teach you what you will need to be successful in a B2B sales position.  They are a great place to start a career and give you the foundation for what other companies look for in sales people.  If you can sell for Cintas, you can sell for anyone and sell anything.  They give you the best products to succeed in the industry and because of that they will continue to be an industry leader.  I would recommend Cintas to anyone looking to begin a sales career and wants to move into the medical or technology fields.  With Cintas on your resume, you will always have recruiters calling you and wanting to talk to you about other opportunities that are out there.
cons: Early meetings, sales numbers and sales commission structures that are constantly changing and leave the reps feeling like the company is just trying to get around paying them.

pros: Good pay, decent benefits, good coworkers.
cons:
The SAP project management made 12 hour days mandatory every Tuesday and Wednesday for over eight months. Weekend work is given with little to no notice. Generally, you are lucky if you are informed on Wednesday or Thursday that you will be required to work that weekend. Makes it difficult to plan your life. They also "blacked out" taking vacation from April through August unless you receive approval from the main project leader three levels above you. Not all employees are treated equally or fairly. Employees working the same positions on the project have vastly different salaries, bonus payments, and stock options. This is due to these people being "detached" from other positions to work on this project, but this project will take four years minimum to complete. 

The vacation policy is not competitive. You only receive 10 days for the first five years, 15 days for years 5-15, and 20 days once you hit 15 years with the company. That's the max vacation you can receive. 

The dress code and grooming policy are antiquated. Business professional (e.g., shirt/tie minimum for men) are required and only short-trimmed mustaches and goatees are allowed for facial hair.

pros: Cintas is structured and efficient
cons: Cintas is old school and corporate structure

review_title: Solid company that is growing if they don't mess it up.
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Raleigh, NC
pros: good benefits, good corporate culture, great people, open to change and new ideas, challenging and never boring. It is a pleasant work environment and I enjoy going to work every day. They are very understanding of needing to take off for numerous reasons. Have the capability to work from home if needed, which is wonderful. There is job security here in the fact that they are understaffed and can't afford to lose anyone.
cons: Have to work there a year to get any sick time/time off. Cintas Managed Solutions - Fire Protection group does not have much room for upward growth. People are not fully appreciated for the work they do. People get promotions but they are long overdue. It appears that if you want to move up within the company you have to be willing to move far away.

review_title: Please Read......If you are considering....Management is Horrible.
pros: 4 Day work week and pretty good benefits.
cons: Where do I begin....I've only been here a few months, and I'm already looking to leave. Management is racist and very untrustworthy. You even find reverse racism at many of their locations. The culture is probably the worst I've ever seen in my career. Supervisors throw management under the bus in order to get promoted, they throw employees under the bus in order to not be accountable. The hours are much longer. Then they try to get over on the DOL and make hourly work, salary so that the company doesn't have to pay Overtime.  If DOL ever came in to audit, the company would probably be shut down. And if there was every a class action suit, they would probably close it's doors as well. I see how they do African American men there, it's almost an institutionalized mentality. It's sad, and I don't to be a part of any company like this. Even though, it's only been a few months, I'm leaving as soon as I find another job. Cintas should be a SHAME of themselves, espcially the Allen, TX branch.

pros: co workers are cool and friendly
cons: Management does not like to help when you need help

review_title: Leaves you feeling like a Tool so the Rich can get richer.
job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Langley, BC
pros: Free benefits! don't having to pay MSP every month, no union dues, paid Birthday off, 2 weeks Vacation or more, RRSP, Stock Sharing, mostly friendly people.
cons: can't take time off, can't take your birthday day off can't get paid extra for not taking it either, always get more work never get more pay, you can make commission but its really hard to make sales if you are good at that you could make $300 in a day.. that is if you can find the time to try to sell.. you gotta wake up super early sometimes 2 am, but you get to go home before 3pm so you miss all rush hour which is good but its hard to fall asleep when its still light out.. you get paid really bad for how hard you work, these salarys on here must be from the magical land of wherever, I get $14.50/h people who have been doing this for 5 years get $15.50/hour (maybe). in a year you get a raise, .17 cents! made my day when I heard that.

cons: All the responsibilities as a CSR. Report deadlines, calls from customers, checking in with SSR's to get answers pertaining to calls that have come in. Oh & don't forget babysitting the service managers to find out why they haven't called customers back or closed out CRF's on the report ! Oh the hole PARTNER thing, Stupid, just get over it employees are not valued at all it's a joke ! Pay seemed great then we find out hourly employees can't really get more than .37 -.40 cent raises, Not even a penny more, CSR;s have no bonuses during the year. The first year of employment no time off and if you miss too much it could be your job ! To strict if we are asked about family work / life balance. The company rips other companies off and rapes them with price increases. Which can be lowered if customers complain. So I have to take the call of them screaming at me, only to say oh, just kidding we can lower it to how it was before,,, Give me a break, !!

job_title: Sales Service Representative in North Las Vegas, NV
pros: Company lies to you and acts like they care
cons: Bonuses are nice and can be earned if wanted

pros: Good training. Potential to make really good money-Weekly pay commission quarterly bonus.  Car package.  Have I hit the 20 word minimum yet?
cons:
-one giant pyramid scheme
-Micro mgmt at its worst.  
-Zero accountability.  
-All commission and pay is handled by your sales manager...there's no set day or time frame of when you get commissions...just when the manager gets to it.
-can do no paperwork between 7:30am -5:30pm
-Honesty gets you nowhere here.  Lie to your managers and lie to the customer and you will make it here.   
-Never mention to customers your signing them up for a 60 month contacts when you are getting them to sign off on their "inventory to set up the account."   
-Reporting a weekly sold number.
-all territories are held and compared at the same number regardless of market conditions.

review_title: What you have done before doesn't matter anymore! Hit PC or bust!
pros: Cintas has a first rate corporate culture with a true sense of being the absolute best. The meticulous hiring process is something that should be used in most industries. The best thing about Cintas is that you are rewarded for your performance in most cases.
cons: Cintas fails in only a few segments, but they are very important. First, I would state that the evaluation of employees is far too numbers driven. Numbers are a great initial metric; however, a performance number is not the only indicator that can be used to determine the suitability for promotion. Often Cintas will promote the top performers with little regard to the skill set required at the next level. Second, Cintas has a lack of procedure in having new promotees acquire the necessary experiences to become effective in their new roles. A more thorough transition process would be an effective change for Cintas to make.

review_title: Experience will vary based upon location
pros: Lots of responsibility and unique leadership opportunities that will be given based purely upon merit. Age and seniority play little to no role in promotions.  It is all about what are your accomplishments and what can you do in the new position.  I was responsible for over $3 million dollars in yearly spend and 12 employees at a very young age.  It was an awesome responsibility and an experience that will shape me for the rest of my life.
cons: Your experience will vary from location to location, region to region, and business unit to business unit.  In my experience, the pay was awful, the hours were long, and the work could be disgusting.  The biggest problem was that a lot of the goals set for management teams by corporate or regional were unrealistic.  This resulted in rampant cheating by people trying to keep their jobs.

job_title: Accounts Payable Clerk in Mason, OH
pros: They have a cafeteria and a big fancy building.
cons:
The Accounts receivable is all staffed by a temp agency so that's telling you something.  The company held a meeting where they explained their way to get out of having to pay taxes; they set up an employee fund for employee hardships (like if you lose your house in a tornado). Cintas puts some money in the pot and then encouraged employees to take a portion of their paycheck into the pot. They actually admitted they want to do this so they can get out of paying taxes. So now you know one of the ways big companies get out of paying thousands maybe millions in taxes. 
For their accountants, they hire kids fresh out of college. They sent a company-wide email saying that the new accountant had messed up the company taxes and was therefore sacked. I feel bad for the kid. 
Accounts receivable mostly consisted of elderly cranky women, so that means low wages and no career advancement. They recently fired almost all of mgmt for unknown reasons so everyone is walking on eggshells, especially the new mgmt.  
The people that are high up in the food chain, treat everyone else like peasants. 
Not at all a family friendly place either. I explained to mgmt a family member was in hospital expecting the worse, I needed time off. Mgmt said it was OK, then let me go the next day. I took off 4 days.

pros: Good benefits and bonus structure
cons: Toxic environment, fake energy, questionable sales tactics from some managers

pros: I literally cannot think of any, I would say autonomy but sales managers will find a way to consistently hound you and breath down your neck, negating the normal autonomy that most sales roles provide.
cons: Too many to accurately list without writing a novel, so I will leave you with a chapter. Aggressive/Borderline harassing sales management to start. You use (beat the crap out of) your own vehicle on daily cold calls. There are unrealistic sales goals right from the start, and practically zero time to build up a pipeline or rhythm in your sales before management will start making threats. I am not a complainer, have never been fired from a job (including this one...left on my own accord in under a year as is about avg for a Cintas sales rep), but this company is by far the worst company I have ever encountered. Employees (particularly sales) are in some ways encouraged to get business by any means necessary. Customers are consistently lied to, and I have seen products be added to invoices during their "quarterly" sales contests. All in all a very shady company to work for, from start to finish. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.

pros: Coworkers were really nice, everyone always tries to help each other out.
cons: Long hours; having to get up at 3:30 am every morning and also deal with the weather conditions. The pay doesn't equate to the workload. You have to make sure the customer is happy by ensuring they receive  their mats, products and uniforms; however, there are plenty of times when the products aren't available.  Sales , Sales Sales!! You are expected to continuously sell products to your customers, while stressed out about the workload.. delivering and getting back to the plant on time.  Too many customers to manager per day and not  a enough time to really spend selling and just servicing the customer's needs. If you tried to do everything that is expected of you, you would be working 14 hour days. Also, you don't get paid standard over-time, it Chinese overtime.   Even though it isnt your fault that products like mats, terry towels and shop towels aren't available that day, it still falls back on you. If the customer is unhappy and you have to give credits because of missing products, it reflects badly on your numbers. Very numbers driven which isn't feasible for what is being put on the ssr.

job_title: Route Service Representative in Normal, IL
pros: Cheap healthcare, four day work week
cons: For the industry we are the lowest paid drivers out of all the major competitors.  Management is horrible. They don’t follow up with customers and don’t take care of issues when you’ve asked them multiple times.  An employee received a DUI January 2018.  He pleaded guilty to the DUI in June of 2018.  Cintas has made sure this guy keeps his job and he has been driven around since February 2018.  Our Normal, IL location has even been paying guys to come in on their “off day” and run the Cintas Uber.  Cintas preaches about corporate culture, it’s all bologna.  We have weekly pointless meetings and they are constantly having us sign off on new policies.  The policies are used against you if you violate them.  Cintas never has your back.  Also, Cintas hates unions.  They don’t want a union within the company.  This is because the way they treat the plant workers wouldn’t fly with them.  The plant workers work in horrible working conditions.  Their pay is barely above minimum wage, it is a borderline sweatshop.  Cintas has so many ads for jobs on every job site. This is because the turnover is so high and they can’t hire people fast enough.  I recommend not wasting your time and look elsewhere for work.

job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Frederick, MD
pros: Flexible Schedule was only pro
cons:
Unnecessary Corporate Check the Box
If you had a poor territory you weren't going to be successful
Missing orders and inventory were constant

review_title: Sophmore employee frustrated with lack of change
pros: I came to Cintas to get out of a toxic work environment.
cons: Out of the proverbial frying pan, and into the fire.   It went well at first, then the cracks started appearing.  Turnover in SSR's averages just over 3 weeks.  My location hasn't been "fully staffed" in over 2.5 years, (my tenure).  The ideal SSR is a robot that sells, not a person.  Taking personal time for illness or family issues makes you less of an employee in management's eyes.  The phrase "do it for your family" is thrown around a LOT.  However, if you want to actually spend time with, or do something for your family, *most* management looks down on you.  If you can't eat, sleep, & breathe Cintas, then don't apply as an SSR.

review_title: Work you for 80, pay you for 40...
pros:
- Industry Leader
- Career Mobility (geographically)
- Expense Reimbursement is fantastic
- Did I mention Industry Leader...because they will...constantly.
cons:

- Hours of operation (5am through...the rest of your life)
- Very Political
- NO training for mid-management
- Disconnected Compensation plan
- Super outdated regarding technology (don't expect a laptop)

review_title: Great place to learn - then leave
pros: Car package and stable company. Upper management will constantly tell you this in order to keep talented reps. These are the two ingredients in the Kool Aid they force feed you.
cons: The Kool aid will make you puke in a very short amount of time. At the end of the day your selling five year contracts for overpriced mats, soap and toilet paper. The fancy dispensers are cheap just ask the SSRs who are constantly replacing them. Price increases create a smoke and mirrors approach to selling. You never want to build relationships with customers because they will inevitably get screwed either through ridiculous price increases or poor service. And guess what, they signed a five year contract that they cant get out of. Management will also talk about all of the great advancement opportunities. BS. Unless you sell your soul, make multiple PCs and kiss butt there is no advancement. They will bring in buddies from a different location. The Cintas sales rep position is not as good as they make it seem during the interview process. This is a very shady sales job. AVOID THIS COMPANY IF WANT TO KEEP YOUR SANITY.

pros: Appreciated their focus on health and safety. Seemed like they really tried to follow their values and were fairly well-organized. Pay was decent, maybe a little on the low side, but benefits were solid. Lots of nice people to work with!
cons: Little room for advancement at my location. Incompetent management leaned on employees to get things done and never bothered to learn how to do aspects of their own job--and upper management never noticed. Very few tools for professional growth. Human Resources was hard to reach and slow to respond, often requiring multiple queries.

job_title: Fire Service Tech in Conshohocken, PA
pros: Outstanding technicians. Good amount of autonomy for day-to-day work. You make your own schedule for the most part. I really enjoyed interacting with customers and seeing some very interesting places & businesses.
cons:
The main issue with Cintas is that they hire their managers straight from college or other industries as managers, not from their technicians. As such, their service managers have little to no industry knowledge. In other words, they don't hire managers from the technician ranks unless you have a college degree. These managers have little to no idea what they're talking about compared to the technicians who actually complete the tasks and understand exactly how long certain tasks take and what is required.

Additionally, I have found that many managers have little to no integrity. They'll say & do whatever they need to in order to meet their sales/service quotas, please their supervisors, and advance their careers. It is very demoralizing to the technicians who actually care about the fire protection industry & customer service.

pros: The only pro is the possibility for a pretty good income.
cons:
This company is full of micro managers.  I have read so many posts on here where people are offended by the negative feedback given by past or present employers.  All I am going to say is this.. Do not believe all of the positive posts on here.  Most people from Cintas are not going to go out of their way to provide positive feedback unless they are with the company and are hurting for people.  Atleast in the sales department.  There are so many jobs/career options out there that pay better, have realistic expectations and who care about you more than Cintas does.  I got screwed on my final salary check, commission check and bonus check.  That is just how the company is. 

And before anyone comments about my post, please note that I am a P-Club and Diamond level sales rep.  It doesn't make a difference how much you pay your employees, the environment in which the company operates is ridiculous.

job_title: Market Development Representative in Huntsville, AL
pros: Cintas has been an excellent company to create my career. They harbor a team environment and implement a successful model at each Cintas location. I have trained and visited various locations around the South East/ Central/ East Coast and without fail they all operate the same. Wherever I go the partners have the same positive and friendly attitude.  Cintas provides countless opportunities for growth, promotion, and support to help me attain my career goals. I will not be leaving Cintas, this is where I want my career to remain. If you're seeking a team environment I strongly encourage you to seek a job opening at Cintas.
cons: I have had good and bad quarters at Cintas. After a quarter that I did not achieve my assigned "number" I received constructive feedback and an improvement plan was implemented. Ultimately I received support to help me achieve numbers going forward. Over almost 4 years I have seen other partners quit after getting frustrated with management directives because they yielded a bad quarter. I have been in their shoes and through my own attitude and drive I turned around my experience.

review_title: Go for the experience, leave for more money
pros:
Great, level headed people who truly want to do what's right for the employee to engage them in a positive culture.  Good foundation of policies, processes.  Gain a lot of experience in certain fields with Cintas.  Cintas truly care's about employee engagement and try's very hard to give people a good working atmosphere.  
Benefits are great, Comp in certain fields is not.

The Management Trainee program is a great program and will teach individuals just out of school a LOT about hard work, ethics, how to review business reports. etc.  

Excellent safety program.  This company truly cares about safety.
cons: Overworked for well below the salary of the position.  It's a man's man industry.  If you are in Sales, great job because you'll be the only one's to make money, which is way to high a salary for the people they hire.  They invest in may positions and people except HR.  They don't want experience here, they want people who will work for nothing.

review_title: Not all that glitters is gold
pros: It's a paying job
cons: From the first day I walked in I was expected to know what to do, I practically begged for training and was lied to over and over again from management. I never recieved training. I had to work long hours for little pay, and keep in mind I was salary. When asked about raises due to the hours and the hard work I was told by my manager that if I was looking for money I was in the wrong place. Management didn't have a spine and allowed certain people to do whatever they pleased because they happened to know a director well, who also was a joke that no one respected. It was just a circus and I went along with the act until I found something else and hit them with the surprise I was leaving. Not saying the company as a whole is bad, because I do not know. But this location is a joke.

job_title: Outside Sales Representative in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Pay was pretty good. Team was fun to work with, excluding my manager.
cons: Micromanagement at its finest. Cintas wants you to sound as close to a robot as humanly possible. No room for individuality. If you enjoy phone blocking and roll playing then this is your dream job. They treat you like a bunch of little children by  offering you trinkets for who makes the most calls or who can read a script word for word the best. They hire you to be an outside sales rep but expect you to be inside making calls and doing all this work that hinders your ability to get out in the field. I would NOT recommend this job to anyone unless you love corporate culture and have no backbone. I also feel sorry for any customers that fall for the contracts they make customers sign.  Managers were the worst,  didn't do anything besides micromanaged and tried to get their names on any large sales at the last minute, to make themselves look good. When in fact they had nothing to do with helping with anything. The company went downhill fast and major turnover after they acquired G & K Services.

pros: I am blessed to have a job.  There is another post about working at Gadsden and that person is completely wrong.  Everyone but 2 ppl have hit their numbers.  And those of us making our numbers have made a lot of extra money. I make an extra $70/week bc of the new pay for PERFORMANCE plan.  If you don't perform (do YOUR job), why should you get paid? Management is very nice but fair. We have had a new plant manager for the past year, and he is great. He works with us.
cons: In the summer, it can be hot. It's a production env. so you need to know that going in. We do have ac though-the bldg is just very big.

review_title: lots of hypocrisy within management, good benefits
pros: benefits, hours, really a lot of good people work there
cons:
too much hypocrisy within management.
management drinks too much kool-aid culture
management lives in fantasy world with ssr expectations.
cheap...this company does NOT like to spend money.
Only worried about bonuses
Will short product at fiscal year end to make numbers,which forces ssr's to screw customers

pros: Good stepping stone into a "corporate career"; Employment with Cintas listed on a resume looks good to future employers
cons: Lack of proper training and tools to become the best that you can be in any given position; Poor management style- GM is "off site" (at home) 85% of the time, the 15% of the time that he does decide to show up, he and the other managers are in meetings that end with one of them coming over to micro-manage the job that you basically trained yourself to do. Outdated software and office practices.  Unethical and inequitable business practices when dealing with customers.

job_title: Sales Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Company has great overall ethics, safety are customer satisfaction are #1, and genuinely care about all of their employees.
Uncapped commission, great pay.
People that work here are truly amazing, company takes recruiting very seriously.
Always promote from within first, tons of opportunity.
Fantastic training for ALL positions.
cons:
Work-life balance.
Micromanagement by management was suffocating. 
Very demanding daily schedule, be ready to drive a ton and work late. The company requires lots of CRM entries per week, so finishing work on your laptop after you get home is very common. 
Creativity and innovation are usually frowned upon.

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Henrietta, NY
pros: Freedom to drive within your territory for cold calling, 401k and matching are good, each rep gets their own van, only have to physically check in with managers once a week, and if working in the right area (major cities) can produce easy income.
cons: The list is endless. The training is beyond terrible (videos and powerpoints are only as good as the people speaking to them - often terrible), everything provided is low quality and set the tone (uniforms - even though it's primarily a uniform company, vans - mine should not have been on the road, handheld devices - crash unexpectedly every day, etc), the pay scheme seriously benefits management without kicking enough back to the people on the ground, coworkers are typically low IQ, GPS and EZPass not provided, usually have to front the cash for costs and wait to get paid back if you keep proper proof of purchase, rewards are commonly opportunities to learn better sales skills which can be hit or miss, "SSR College" is a JOKE - didn't learn anything I didn't already know after being an SSR for 3 months prior, etc.

review_title: Run it like its your own business?
pros: Bennifits, Good safe environment, overprotective and to much of a 30,000 foot focus.
cons:
No proper risk assessments,  employees are espectied to work as if all hazards can and should be removed.  investigations for people who turn their ankle on a pebble in the parking lot.

No real time off.  long arduous hours work load that cannot possibly be done and done right by one person.  must be a jack of all trades and focus on the flavor of the day.  Safety, projections, customers, partners, and enogh daily and weekly checklist to choke an elephant.

review_title: Don't expect to have a life outside of your job at Cintas
pros: Steady work, liveable pay and cool coworkers a good place to learn a big lesson about Corporate behavior. Any job you take after Cintas will feel like a dream job.
cons: Cintas can care less about their partners. You are not allowed to have either a life outside of work or an opinion. If you have either of those you will be retaliated against. The atmosphere is that of fear and high stress. Non compensated OT is expected. The customers you call on hate you and treat you very badly. You will have something of yours (including your car ) stolen or broken into as  theft is rampant. Only company cheerleaders are promoted and once promoted you can expect to work even longer hours. HR uses social media to conduct witch hunts. You are expected to work sick so you will become ill from coworkers.

review_title: Learned a lot, got micro managed at the end!
job_title: Fire Service Technician in San Jose, CA
pros:
Decent Pay
Hours are to be expected in the Fire Alarm/Sprinkler industry
NFPA code driven, and very customer friendly.
cons:
Schedulers do not know how to read maps, send people to jobs 100+ miles away, while other technicians live closer. (happens all the time, not just isolated incidents)
 Management (GM, Ops Manager and some Service Managers) has never worked in the Fire Protection business prior, They don't speak the lingo or know any actual technical information regarding Fire Alarm Panels or Sprinkler Systems.
Advancement opportunities are few and far between, they interview techs who have been with the company for years but pass them up for fear of loss revenue once the tech is no longer in the field.
Many times reports have to be done after the shift because the jobs are bid incorrectly.
Service managers are on top of you because there managers are on top of them, and everyone knows that poop runs down hill

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Ontario, CA
pros: Cintas allows you to make more money by growing your route with quarterly growth bonuses With a maximum of $2000 for each quarter, that's an extra $8000 a year as long as you grow your route. We have great communication at our location. We have very good benefits, 401(k) with match and profit-sharing. Positive attitude a must.
cons: This is not a job for a lazy person. If you coming to this job with a bad attitude you will fail, you will have no growth,no bonuses, and your attitude will reflect that. Must have great customer service to have any chance to succeed, i've been with Cintas 14 years and had the same route almost 13 years now. I've grown every year and been compensated for it, it is not a clean job, and labor-intensive, but CINTAS gives you the tools to make it work. But it's up to you. You will not just be handed anything, you must earn it !

pros: Cintas is a very competitive environment; if you put in the work (not in hours terms) and execute, you will be recognized. They love to promote from within the company and the culture is something that is reiterated every day. The compensation structure is mostly bonus based, and people in the Sales Department are usually the highest paid. A great place to enter the workforce; they will teach you a lot and are always looking to promote people. Do your job and exceed expectations and nothing but good things will happen.
cons: Cintas is a very "GE like" Company - it can easily become an individuals battle and teamwork is sometimes hard to come by. More of the what-did-you-do-for-me mentality. Frustration leads to arguments etc etc. It is very easy to be shady in this company. There are a lot of people who can definitely learn something from Adam Sandlers Business Ethics debate. If you want to get ahead yourself and screw over your co-workers AND the customer, it is very easy. Beware of the drama, because if you let it then it will absolutely consume you.

pros: Fair compensation for work asked to do.
cons: Executive leadership is disconnected from the field operations. They really have no idea of the daily challenges faced daily by mid level managers. The support for management is lacking in the area career development a most top level managers "look" the same. Therefore, a lot of the decisions do not reflect the diversity of thought needed to move the organization forward. Ultimately this company is looking for robots that look and act like top level management, if your not "in" you will be out. The technology is horrible for an organization this size as they refuse to invest this critical need.

review_title: "Follow the Playbook" &  look out for tons of mgmt changes which will make you continually re-create your personal brand
pros:
Industry Leader
Stellar Training for new reps and continuing training for all reps
Great $$$ for sales reps if you make your #'s
Pride in Company
Always bringing new products to the line makes selling fun and not get stale
cons:
If you don't "drink the Kool-Aid" you won't last long
High management turn-over makes it hard bc you have to constantly re-create your personal brand
Many times you are just a # to higher-ups...if you're not PC pace, you're nothing to them
No loyalty to producing employees who want to transfer markets
Yes, you get paid well...but you will work very very long hours

pros: My particular department had great training by many people, allowing me to get to know others and have a solid idea of how to do my job. Supervisors and managers in my department were all wonderful people who treated us like adults which is how it should be. Overtime was limited to only two hours over 40, anything else required approval.
cons: The pay was not at all commensurate with the job responsibilities. A 2% raise on $12/hour handling multi-million dollar accounts was such a joke I literally laughed when I was told (to be fair, my supervisor thought it was just as awful as I did). Benefits were okay, vacation time not so great. Senior management gave face time to lower employees but didn't really like to listen to problems, perceived or otherwise. Management trainees were mostly men with just enough of a smattering of females to consider themselves "equal opportunity." Work limited to 40 hours, but enough work for 50+ so be prepared to let things fall by the wayside on a regular basis.

review_title: Excellent place to work and an Amazing Corporate Culture!!
job_title: Director of Sales in Chicago, IL
