pros: Cintas is an amazing place to work!  I was fortunate enough to work for this great company for over 4 years in a Director of Sales position.  The corporate culture is like no other company, leadership actually cares about their "partners", and as long as you are a results-oriented person then the sky is the limit for you.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND Cintas to anyone who's interested in working for a large, publically traded company with a GREAT CULTURE!
cons: The only area Cintas could improve in is by having the ability to make quicker decisions and eliminating some of the "Red Tape".  With that said, some of this is absolutely necessary since the organization is so large, but by giving more decision making ability to the "FIELD LEADERSHIP TEAM" will allow the company to take their business to the next level.  Other than that IT IS ONE OF THE BEST COMPANY'S THAT I HAVE EVER OR WILL EVER WORK FOR!

review_title: Highly disorganized, little opportunity for growth, poor compensation
job_title: Territory Account Representative in Mason, OH
pros:
Management is completely flexible with time off.
Management does seem to be sincerely interested in your success.
Close knit environment, great opportunity to network, meet friends, etc.
cons:
Many people in management seem to lack the basic qualifications for their position and subsequently come across as being in over their head.
Sales structure is such that you are often competing with Cintas coworkers to get the sale - i.e., I may offer the customer one price and then a Cintas driver or local sales guy may come in and undercut me.
Antiquated systems - much of the sales CMS and admin functions are driven by a series of Excel spreadsheets.
Compensation and benefits (401k match!) are very poor.
If you're not management, you are on a need-to-know basis and you are treated as such.

pros: Solid initial training program. Monthly auto stipend and gas card for all sales reps. Flexibility to build own schedule on field days.
cons: Job expectations far outweigh potential opportunities. Poor leadership. Review of compensation potential during interview process is not close to the reality of the position. My location is way overstaffed in the sales department in a territory that is already heavily saturated with Cintas customers. Huge disconnect between sales and service, with a lack of accountability to fix issues in a timely fashion. We are not rewarded for our achievements at my location, creating a toxic environment.

job_title: First Aid &Amp; Safety Service Sales Representative
pros:
Good products.
Good commission structure.
Theoretically adequate training.
When all the parts get it right, there is no better first aid and safety company.
cons:
...the problem is, they almost never get it right. 
I was thrown onto a route with 0 product training, no introduction to thier sales process and no info on current customers. I spent the first few months convincing angry customers not to quit. I was there a year and a half before I was able to go to thier week-long new service rep training, so much of I already knew.
As mentioned by others, I was constantly hamstrung by lack of product or slow delivery.
I understand the need for corporate uniformity, but the constant, required meetings and busy work felt monotonous and pointless.
Also as mentioned often, there is no work-life balance. It is expected that work comes first, last and always. I worked 12 hour days, often putting in time on the weekends trying to catch up. This emphasis seemed to come straight from the top.

pros: Great Training, Attractive Compensation, Diverse Product Line, Great People, Good Reputation, Job Options, Geographic Mobility, Presidents Club, Stable Employer, History
cons:
Having spent 5+ years in all 4 departments with 4 promotions, (service, production, sales and G&A) it is clear Cintas lacks middle management competency. "Partners" are promoted based purely on results, and we all know that often the best players make the worst coaches. Cintas is not supportive of "partners" pursuing higher education even in their own time. On three occasions pay plans were adjusted after the pay terms finished. My number one rule is don't mess with my money.

During my tenure, we were without a Human Resource Manager/Department, regionally or locally for 3 out of 5 years. Human Resources were not about improving the quality of their personnel assets, rather, for interviewing and hiring to keep up with the revolving door.

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Strong company culture.  
The company really does care about its employees, referred to as partners.   For the most part, the company tries to do the right thing.
cons:
Strong company culture, you either fit in or you don’t.   
The company needs to do more recognition of its partners.  We work hard but don’t get a lot of thank you’s or recognition events.

review_title: Company is good but this location is bad
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bossier City, LA
pros: Cintas has the right ideas, morals and values of how a company should operate and treat their employees. I've seen some locations that really have a happy atmosphere.
cons: I read other people's cons to the pay for work expected and figured it couldn't be that bad.  They are right!  I wear way more hats than I should for the pay I receive. It is ridiculous the amount of work I do for the measly pay I receive.  My Cintas does not have a strong GM and does not fully back his management team.

review_title: Decent pay and benefits. Demanding work.
job_title: Route Sales Representative in Hamilton, ON
pros:
- Four 10 hour work days per week.
- Active work (not sitting all day).
- Decent pay and benefits.
cons:
- Very physically demanding, often resulting in poor work/life balance as you are tired at the end of the day and need to rest on your days off.
- Depending on the route, your work days can easily be more than 10 hours.
- Profit driven. Not people driven.
- It's said that as an RSR you have control over your route, to treat it as your business. In reality RSR's have very little real control when already over-worked, yet are asked to keep increasing businesses. 90% of the time, increased business on your route means more work for you to do.

job_title: Outside Sales Representative in Fort Myers, FL
pros:
Car Package 
Almost impossible to get fired from this company
cons:
Early & long hours
Lack of training 
Military style management 
Culture creates frustrated employees 
Horrible On-boarding process 
Stuck in the "old way" of doing things and refuses to adopt new age practices around:
- Sales process and methodology
     - not customer centric, door to door style sales, inconveniences the customer 
- Technology and software 
- Business Process Automation 

Politics are the main factor in who gets promoted and who enjoys their time while actually working 

NO WORK LIFE BALANCE (which during the interview process they preach how focused they are on this for their employees) 

Micromanagement is the only style of management used - you will be treated like a child in school, not a working professional

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Denver, CO
pros: There was a nice level of freedom and support.
cons: The level of work required to bonus was not proportional to one another. The only way to get off the minimum pay was to bonus. Highly underpaid for the Denver market. You basically keep 7-10% of your sales with an average of roughly $40-$120 per stop, and you might get 12-15 stops a day, which is exhausting. You do the math. Sure there are your occasional big stops that might get you a $300 sale, but don't forget you only keep 7-10% of your sales. It was by far the most corporate place I've ever worked for and the reason why I will never work for a publicaly traded company again.

pros: Cintas is known as an employee that will promote anyone regardless of degree as long as they prove themselves through hard word.  Many of the middle management came started as hourly workers, many without college degrees.
cons: Cintas works its lower-level salaried employees to the bone.  Management trainees (just out of college) were often called in to work the production floors on weekends to prevent running overtime with hourly employees.  While the management trainee program is billed as giving high-potentials exposure to many aspects of the business, I found most of my 2 years in the program was spent running delivery routes and cleaning restrooms late night (one of their services) in order to make up for consistent staffing shortages and high turn-over.

job_title: First Aid & Safety Service Sales Representative in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Managers CARE about your success because it reflects their success.
cons: When routes get too big, they cut the routes down to create a new route.  This directly affects your pay because if your route is the one that is too big you lose more customers than other routes and sort of "start over" with a smaller territory, making less commission.  You then start building it again over the years until they cut it down again.  Cycle continues.

review_title: Am unethical company that hides behind it's rhetoric
pros: Very few. 4 day work week.
cons: Oh where to start. Constant pressure to perform on a level that is unsustainable. Adding products to customers invoices then playing dumb as to how it got there. Constantly crediting customers money back for to the aforementioned fact. You have to drink the kool-aid. If you're one of the boys, you'll do fine. But if you call anyone on their b.s. they'll find a way to get rid of you. Backstabbing partners. Gain your trust then turn and sabotage you for no gain of their own,  just to do it. Extremely long hours as management. The day never ends, even when you get home. Phone calls and texts never ends. SSRs who work only 4 days a week and you have to run their route. Plenty of bs corporate politics. Watch what you say and who you say it to. As a matter of fact, just say nothing at all. The only people who love this job are the people who literally live, breathe, and drink Cintas. If you have children, expect not to see them much. If you have a wife, expect the same. The most successful people in Cintas are those with no family.

review_title: Can be a good company if you get in the right starting job
pros: Company culture is pretty partner-centric.  Big focus on safety of employees.  Health benefits are pretty good (through Anthem).  Some opportunity for advancement, with potential to make six figures.
cons: If you are hired into an administrative position, the ability to advance is severely limited.  It's typically a popularity contest, and management tends to be predominantly male.  Unless you start as a management trainee or have a masters in business management, advancing to any higher-paying position is pretty impossible.  Morale can be low at times, as the particular branch I'm with can get pretty "clique"-ish.  Upper management has no concept of the amount of work admins have, thus expectations are unrealistic at times--resulting in a job well done going unnoticed and any mistakes causing persecution.

pros: Most locations have great leadership and have a great culture.  They promote from within and have a family type atmosphere where everyone has the others back and help each other to succeed.
cons:
-The ones without the great culture at the leadership level are left on their own for too long and can implode losing a lot of good partners in the process before anything gets done about it.  
-They take spartan to a whole new level.  Raises are very small and hard to come by.  
-New people are hired in at higher rates based on the current market value, leaving tenured employees making next to nothing and feeling battered and used.
-Commissioned job targets are always moving and when you get it nailed down and start making money they change it again.

pros: Career advancement opportunities, free uniforms, good parking, well lit restrooms, big break room, never run out out of toilet paper.
cons: I don't know where to start really.  Pay plan really sucks, they want this role to pretty much reflect a SM role in many ways. There's no car package and you use your own car a lot(visiting customers, delivering short product), they don't pay for any phone service and your constantly communicating(SSRs, the office, SM's, customers, reading emails ) with your phone. If you have to run a route for an extended amount of time (2-3 months) your home/work life balance really suffers because you're doing two jobs and putting in 50+ hrs a week. As much as they worry about SSRs hours, nothing is ever said or any member of management cares about how many hours you put in.  And don't complain or you'll be labeled as one and non promotable.

review_title: Its a good place to get sales experience.
pros:
Great compensation when you hit your numbers
Great Health Insurance
Good place to get experience if you are willing to relocate
cons:
Price increases make you feel guilty about selling
Selling in a place you live turns people against you
Talk about a CHEAP company... I know we're in a recession but give me a break. 
Extremely outdated computer technology
I could go on and on

review_title: Work Hard and you'll make good money!
pros: Great sales Training program, where they will teach you to be a hunter and close business.  The harder you work the more money you make.  Opportunity to make over $100K in sales.  Car package is one of the best I've seen besides a company giving you an actual car.  When the time is right to leave Cintas, other companies greatly respect their training program and the experience you've gained from working there. Hit as many president clubs as possible and you will be able to go anywhere you want! Many former Cintas sales reps leave to go do medical or pharma sales.
cons: With any sales job, it will be extremely competitive.  You will be phone cold calling as well as face-to-face cold calling.  You will rack up a crazy amount of miles on your car. Cut-throat competitive.  Depending on your direct manager, will depend on your overall happiness. Hard to move up.  Favorites are played often.

pros:
- Good benefits 
- 4 day work week
- Company has weekly meetings to over things 
- Good training for position
cons:
- Pay is average 
-Physically demanding 
- Pick up and deal with smelly uniforms and mats 
- You will scan hundreds of uniforms daily by hand (often times in smelly locker rooms or bath rooms)  
- They provide you with old trucks that they make you do maintenance checks on every morning. Most trucks will have terrible heating and no air conditioning 
- If you have a degree you most likely won't like anything about this position. You will essentially be a glorified janitor. Nothing wrong with that, most just wouldn't find this work enjoyable.

pros: I did research on the company they looked good on paper
cons: I had 2 phone interviews followed by an in person interview & then a call back for a 2nd in person interview. When I arrived that afternoon I was told my interviewer had a family emergency & it would have to be rescheduled. Although I was supposed to meet with 2 different people that day & the other person was there but I was told that the was an order I was supposed to meet with ppl. and to be patient they normally interview ppl no less than 6-8 times in their hiring process. I came back for the total of 6 interviews the last I was repeatedly told if I don't get selected for the 2 openings for the position I was interviewing for to just keep applying to Cintas because it was a great company to work for & they thought I was a good fit. Needless to say I wouldn't ever let them waste that much of my time, energy & effort in driving out there & the stress of repeated interviews again. It was the most ridiculous waste of time.

review_title: Not exactly what I thought it would be, look elsewhere - I would have if I could do it over
pros:
-Pay is competitive
-People you work with are really great
-Senior leadership seems solid
-The services and products Cintas provides its customers is really very good
-The ride alongs I have done were with people very good at their job
cons:
-Middle management is terrible, only a few good ones here
-IT maturity is laughable at best
-Poorly handled system implementations
-Budget is comical on how it is allocated
-Turnover is crazy in IT (14-15%)
-For people under my career level, upward trajectory is near impossible
-Duration of employment and amount of hours is more valued than good experience, education, outside views and efficiency
-People allocation is sub par, meaning people come in and never come out (no work to do, under used, poor fit)
-IT management is filled with people not qualified in their area making micromanagement decisions and managing teams and hiring of sub par people
-Not able to hang onto younger talent, losing them to other companies
-Poor job match
-Way too silo'd business units and support
-Culture of the company, dress code, values pushed down by senior leadership is not really bought into by other employees

pros: Great coworkers, good benefits, fun activities during work hours
cons: Local management varies greatly from location to location. Training for managers was a joke; it’s mostly computer modules and seminars for 20-25 people. Little training or feedback on how to be successful in your role. Communication from corporate is poorly managed with field locations. Very cheap on salary and business travel; you buy your own lunch when traveling to support other offices and for training. Long hours and the need to come in on weekends. Was not given VPN to be able to improve work/life balance. Business professional dress 5 days/week. The entire company will go on a hiring freeze if the numbers aren’t good, which does nothing but lose potential candidates already interviewing and leave operations short staffed. Outdated software with minimal support. Ridiculous audits.

job_title: Services Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
Stable Company
Large Organization
Competitive benefits
Good opportunities for entry-level partners
Long-term company growth
cons:
Lots of micromanaging

Nepotism---if you want to grow or move up, it's all about rubbing elbows with the right people and being part of the boy's club

Insane hours. Service Manager workday is from 4:30am to 11:pm

Upper leadership (group/regional level) is inconsistent and often talks out of both sides of their mouth. Lack of clarity and consistency.

Outdated policies, especially regarding attendance, dress, and appearance.

Cintas will squeeze everything the can out of managers and watch them burn out.

pros: The hours are decent and it is a solid 40 hour work day. They offer decent medical benefits. Management is relatively friendly. The safety supervisor and HR representatives do take employees concerns seriously and are alwayse available to talk.
cons: It can be very strenuous and hot labor. The building has cooling issues and your on your feet for 7 hrs. Sometimes it feels like management ignores safety issues or doesn't communicate back with employees. It is a very diverse workplace which while neat leads to some significant communication issues as not all the employee's speak fluent English. Communication between shifts is improving but could be better.

review_title: Its a job but not a career for me.
pros: Competitive pay, very good benefits, some very good people to work with.
cons: I feel I am lead to be dishonest with customers by the management. Seems to be some very underhanded things going on recently with the management towards the partners at Cintas.

pros: On going learning of new products.  4 day work week, weekends off,
cons: Low compensation, monthly bonus is based on 5 or less expired contracts.  If a contract expires within 1 year its counted against the SSR for the monthly bonus. Who really signs a contract before it expires unless you're looking to change something drastically on the account.  Makes no sense.  Disincentive for growing your route as an SSR.  You get paid 3% per $10,000 and then only .5% more for every $1000 you add on.  This is not how someone grows the route.  Idea is to sell more out of the catalog but the pricing of the catalog is outrageous.  In an era of internet pricing this is crazy.  Constant meetings over unnecessary materials and only management speaks.  If they paid better this would be an ok company to work for.  Winters can be hard and long.  Going in and out of a business.  Work is hard and back breaking if you're there too long.

review_title: Entry level and they work you like it.
pros: Great Resume builder, you get a chance to work in different area of the company and learn about all of it.  Great benefits these are what they use to attract lower level production employees and it works because they are good.  Your job is always changing, there wasn't a role that I was ever bored in.
cons: Pay isn't anything special, and I feel like management was always trying to pay you less for more work.  If you don't have a good GM like any other place you won't have a good management experience.  They work you and expect you to drink the kool aid without any loyalty to you.  They jam a price increase down their customers throats every year, and really screw the little guy, it's painfull to watch/do.

review_title: Hard work, great development, put a lot on your plate.
pros: Extremely hands on and immediate impact to the organization when you start. Not a desk job. Great company values but inconsistent execution across locations. Comp is low for managerial, competitive for similar sales roles. Develop their talent pool well- all partners invested in their own development see a return on hard work and drive to learn.
cons: As MT and future leader they give you more than you can handle to see how you prioritize and delegate. Same goes for Service Management. Coaching those skills helps but a 360 change doesn't happen overnight. Burn out rate is high for those who hold themselves to a high standard. The work is never done.

pros: Working as an Intern at Cintas was a great experience. Management was honest and very respectful. My manager catered to what I wanted to get out of the internship. Going into it I had no idea what to expect because of the broad description, but I learned about so many aspects of the business which really made the program great. Boss would buy us lunches on Fridays to review what we liked and didn't like from the week so he could help improve the program. Very positive work environment. Management is being honest when they say they will listen to everyone's ideas and take them seriously, even if you started that week. Good pay and flexible hours.
cons: Maybe a little more structure in the program would be beneficial, but I'm sure if you worked there for more than a month or 2, management would schedule it out for you.

job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Huntsville, AL
pros: Sales training program is elite. I still use principals taught at Cintas in my current role. The car package and gas card is nice.  I worked with some really nice people.
cons:
Extreme micro management. You must constantly stay in front of your number week in and week out to the point that if you have one down week, your entire work ethic is questioned (regardless on where you are in your quarterly or yearly number). Prices are extremely high compared to competitors. Management expects everyone to drink the Kool Aid to no end. 

Have you ever seen a couple that you know is going through problems try to be over the top on social media about how much they love each other? That’s how Cintas feels. Everyone is forced to fake enthusiasm to the point where it is annoying. Just follow a few employees on LinkedIn and you will understand.

pros: If you do your job well, then you will likely never have to worry about having a job there though you might never get promoted.  You have to be content with holding the same position or remaining at the same level (individual contributor, first line manager, etc.) for your entire career.
cons: Politics are paramount when deciding on good promotions.  Most senior leaders will not present information to the person above them contrary to what they think that person wants to hear, which destroys shareholder value by their not fighting for what is best for the long term value of the company.  Incentive plans encourage managers to emphasize short term results, and to make decisions that at times can hurt profitability and cash flow.  Sales is not given enough incentive to worry about profitability or return on assets, leading to shareholder value destroying transactions.  The accounting/finance department does not forecast well (due to possible under-staffing), which hurts the incentive plans of managers in the field.  There is no up or out policy, allowing average managers to hold key and limited availability positions for decades, which stifles the possibility of advancing more talented leaders and business managers, destroying shareholder value.

pros:
Decent pay
Good benefits
Good professional management and sales training for future
cons:
Every location is run differently
Corporate objectives change weekly!
What's the flavor of the week?
Don't convert your salary into an hourly wage. You will want to mow lawns.
Culture is difficult to adjust to.
If you try to do something good for the customer, Cintas will roll out a price increase and make you look like a liar.
Don't service customers where you know people.

pros: benefits are ok and your coworkers are nice.  A couple of managers are competent and hold the place together, despite the GM and upper management.
cons:
GM is totally incompetent and has low self esteem.  Replies on those under him/her to get things done despite being a workaholic.  

Management knows no work/personal boundaries and expect you to be on call 24/7.

Constant emails at all hours of the day on weekends and holidays as well.

No work/life balance

Too focused on "today" rather than the big picture.

Pretends to care about the customer, but really only concerned with the bottom line.

Career ladder is short.  No room for advancement.

pros: Cintas has very good benefits, so far I have experienced good support from management. If I see something is not working out I suggest a solution and so far they have worked on it. Room for advancement, they have a lot of opportunities but you really have to earn them, you have to work your tail off but your hard work will pay off. Promotions are based on how hard you work and not how long you have been working here. So for the hard working individuals this is a rewarding career.
cons: Pay could be a little better. You will work with lazy people who complain and won't do what they are supposed to do because the job is hard. Long hours, hard back breaking work, not meant for work-shy individuals. Old trucks that break down a lot.

review_title: Be prepared for long days... for most of us.
job_title: Service Sales Representative in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good benefits, they are more expensive than fortune 100 companies I have worked for in the past. I like having 3 days off. They allow for time off for person issues.
cons: The workweek is classified as a 4x10, it usually ends up being a 4x12 or more. The position is commission so the overtime calculation is very suspect. There is no tuition assistance, and since it is nearly impossible to advance without a degree your pretty much stuck. Positions to promote to are limited. The job experience depends on how good your route is. The company wants you to sell products on route while your route is overloaded with stops, there is no time to sell anything. Nearly Service Sales Rep is overworked.

review_title: Many variables depend on how you will end up
job_title: Service Sales Representative in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Not stuck in an office all day. You can really make some good friends out on route, even find a great trustworthy mechanic. Starting pay isn't bad, benefits are great. Potential for a gravy route the longer you stay. 4 day work week.
cons: Early morning meetings at 5:30am, 12 hour days, no overtime (it's called Premium Pay which doesn't mean 1.5X your normal rate), some managers don't manage anything so you do all the work on your route, raises are almost non-existent, some customers kill your potential for a nice bonus. Sometimes too many (account managers/sales) involved in your accounts.

review_title: The grass is truly greener outside of Cintas!
pros:
Professional Development - A lot is expected from you, so you will develop skills in "trial by fire".
Career Promotion - If you have what it takes, you will move into higher positions, which are constantly opening up as those individuals get burnt out or get fired.
cons:
Very low Morale - Many front line employees are frustrated and discouraged with the company.
Short Term Decision Making - Most decisions that are made are focused solely on the current budget year's profit or projections. This leads to many of the frustrations that will keep you handling the same issues and problems year after year. 
Too Many Levels of Management - There are many levels of management that are constantly trying to put their stamp on the company. You will find that when there are several levels of management and divisional specialists above you delegating their tasks and objectives, it will be hard not to either dis-engage or get burnt out trying to keep up.

review_title: Company is profitable but the employees won't see their share of it.
pros: The people themselves are great. Management...not so much.
cons:
Pay below industry standard. Distribution of pay raises, promotions, etc are NOT awarded fairly or necessarily based on merit. Company culture is very much based on extroversion and having the "right image," rather than on job performance. Management likes to hire their friends, neighbors, etc. Shady job placement policies, like open positions being posted for two days before the job is given to a predetermined hire.

Tons of rules, or rather, "policies," but they are not applied equally to all employees. Company is so profitable they were able to buy a competitor recently for about $2 billion, but the majority of employees will not get a cut of that abundant profit.

pros: Workers are some of the most kindest people you will ever meet.
cons:
Management. Executives. And collared job positions are all in their high chairs. Production managers will pester you continuously to pick up the pace, in an extremely rude manner... Though you're going as fast as you possibly can. 

Machine operators are paid just over $13/hour in Ontario. Lowest machine operator wage I've ever seen. Average is about $15-$20 for a machine operator job in Canada. 

Men are not allowed to have earrings. But woman are. I had to take mine off every time. Although this would have been normal in the 1930s-1960s... It's considered sexism in the 21st century.
The Farmers could benefit greatly by adapting to today's culture. 
10 to 25+ years just to move up to a management position is not motivating at all.

review_title: Good place to work but its got some flaws
pros:
Great work ethic and enthusiasm - super courteous group of employees
Provides a decent living for individuals without a advanced degree in the route sales position 
They really want to satisfy the customer - uniforms are the most comfortable in the industry. 
Benefits package especially the pension plan is very good.
Recent emphasis on safety initiatives is impressive - working towards being world class.
cons:
Extremely political and run by a primarily white male managers
Sacrifice great customer service in order to make the numbers - they don't provide the product to the route drivers in order save on costs. Plants are understaffed and lack automation. 
Disparity in time off programs by position - sick and vacation time is less for office and plant, compared to salaried/management employees - why?

pros: SSR’s often only work 4 days a week.  If your in management or any other position other than SSR you will not be held accountable for anything.
cons: Unethical pay model. Underhanded and overly aggressive to customers.  As an SSR anything that goes wrong anywhere in the company is your fault. Company only cares about money. Company often has a if you don’t like it beat it attitude. Company operates as if it is the only company in the field. Corporate culture is only for the plant workers and management service reps. are second hand employees to this company.

job_title: Sales and Service Representative in Chandler, AZ
pros: 4 Day work weeks.  Never weekends.  Avg. of 38 hrs a week.  You control how much $$ you want to make with the commissions and bonus / direct sales package.  Awesome benefits that are cheap due to the company being so big.
cons: There is a lot of physical and dirty labor involved.  You are working with dirty laundry and soiled towels and mats.  It is hot and can get very tiring in the summer.

job_title: Healthcare Major Account Manager in Conway, SC
pros: The people you work with are exemplary. Hard work is the ethos of Cintas and their corporate culture is everything. If you are a top performer you will be allowed a great deal of freedom to do your work. The training for sales is second to none and the business acumen is of the highest regard.
cons: If you are not a person who likes to be trained, if you like to be average or are happy making under $100k per year in sales, you will not enjoy Cintas. They are tireless, challenging, honest, ethical and demand the highest level of performance from their partners. If you do not like to be "managed" and "taught" how to sell, you will not enjoy Cintas.

review_title: If you are talented and driven - this is the company to work for!
job_title: Uniform Sales Representative in Sacramento, CA
pros:
Working for the leader in the industry gives you the competitive edge
Talented and tenured management
constant training
Consistent and fair feedback from Management
Coworkers dedicated to doing the right thing for the company and the customer
Working for a company of integrity
cons:
The primary con in a company of this breadth and depth, is deciding which track to take your career.  If you are a hard worker - it can be difficult to decide on the career buffet Cintas offers.  
If you are not determined to be the best, and work hard at getting there, and be able to listen to and apply constructive criticism - you will not last here.

review_title: Fast Pace...Can Not"Let Up" on the Gas-Every Week you have to make it count or you will fall behind, easily
pros:
1)Love Fast-Pace!
2)They have an app you can use to keep track of onsite visits, new presentations and sold accounts-can also preview the account to see what other partners have said after they had visited the account
3)Great team of Executives been with Cintas forever-unfortunately they are all in Evansville, Indiana or Cincinnati,OH 
But are in town 1x a Quarter and give awesome training!
4)Able to give customers trials on products before they commit to a 'Service Guaranteed Agreement' (the agreement was great too compared to competitors)
cons:
Culture shock in sales enviroment compared to previous sales enviroment.

Commissions hard to keep track of.

review_title: Not for everyone, great for a specfic type of person.
pros: Decent benefits, mostly friendly coworkers, 4 days a week for SSRs, lots of room to grow and be promoted.  Safe place to work.  If you are very competitive and don't mind blue collar work, this is good spot to land.
cons: Cold corporate mentality, yet lots of KoolAid.  Service management is a boy's club, can be unprofessional.  Most managers worked their way up with no college education, some see ambitious young people as job threats.  Inner-circle is visible - the GM and 2 or 3 service managers. Politics in the workplace.   Lots of aggressive alpha-dog types, prevents cohesion and diversity.

review_title: Think about what your'e getting yourself into
pros: Partners working with you are great depending on your location.
cons: Long interview process where they don't really share the fact that you are going to be waking up in the middle of the night for shifts. You will be doing intense labor for 12 to 14 hours a day, if you consider that, the compensation is actually not ideal at all. There are times where you will travel and get home late. Even when you get home late you are expected to be back at work at 5 am. Overall the position will sound good and hyped the recruiters and or the people you interview with but in the end you will be overwhelmed almost everyday. Unless you can handle long, dirty and weird work hours that are mostly labor intensive this position is not for you.

review_title: Work hard and you can succeed. Leadership roles should expect incredibly long hours. Very long hiring process.
job_title: Region Service Manager in San Jose, CA
pros: Great benefits, OK bonus if your location performs well. Generally good partners, low tolerance for unethical behavior.
cons: Brutal hours required. As a service manager I worked 70+ hours a week for 3 years. Other Service Managers are rarely held accountable for their actions. A lot of talk about corporate culture, as if the talk alone would make it happen. Given very little training, expected to learn on the fly, which is a lot of why managers aren't held accountable. Nobody quite understands what they do. Operations team is expected to contribute more to growth than the sales team is, which is crazy.

review_title: Cintas is a solid company to work for - very conservative and traditional.  You won't regret working for Cintas.
pros: Cintas is a solid company, with a proven track record.  If you are looking for great work experience with a reliable company, Cintas is a great place.  The pay is good, and the people are great.  I have a lot of autonomy, which I really like.
cons: Cintas does not like to spend a lot of money on their employees (outside of income).  By this I mean, "Uncle Cintas" does not like to pick up the check or treat you to much.  No Christmas bonus, low per diem travel amounts, no national sales conference, etc...  Very conservative and traditional.

pros: I feel the best reason to work at Cinats is the fact that your working independently, and for the most part there is no one over you shoulder all day.
cons: The downside to Cintas is the fact that we have to "get over " on the customers and not all of them just the little ones. The bigger your company the cheaper your prices will be. You'll also get less price increases and fewer l/r's ( lost/ replacement) charges. As a driver if I don't get your price increases to stick or if I don't get enough l/r's for clothes, towels, mops, mats and everything else we service it will directly reduce any raise I might get.

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Ashland, KY
pros: You only work four days a week if you are a route driver and that is where you make the most money. They have an excellent 401k program and the benefits are great but costly. Fellow employees are great to work with and some of upper management.
cons: You have to fight and prove to them every dime that you earn. Their new pay plan has no incentive for you to grow and build your route...ie; the more weekly volume you run the less the percentage you make. The only way that you can move up into a management position is if you take a significant pay cut and have a college degree.

job_title: Uniform Sales Representative in Central Islip, NY
pros:
Great Training and continuous.
Good compensation if you do well
Great sales training for any job 
Many products to offer customer
cons:
Service, Service, Service... Its totally opposite of how they train you to sell it.  Always short handed with service people
Multiple price increasing in one year.
Canibalism with sales force.  Facility sales and uniform sales fight for same up and down business.
Unethical sales representatives.  they want to hit their number and will do shady things to customers and other reps to get there.
Leaky bucket when it comes to customers.  
Reps do various things to get volume that not only hurts the company financially, it makes the customers mad and it hurts the drivers with their numbers.

review_title: First Aid & Fire Division: great Company to build credibility
pros: Strong culture centered on the customer. The company has a number of policies & procedures that can help you run the business effectively. Furthermore, the name is well recognized in Uniforms so the brand allows you to sell the business. Also, you can move up the company very quickly through the Advanced Mgmt program, especially if you are willing to relocate. Benefits are comparable to other large companies.
cons: The pay is below the market average with an annual 3% raise. Mgrs are expected to work very long hours with very little overhead support. The pay is made up of a base + bonus and a car package. Most Service Mgrs start at $45-55k with a $20k annual bonus. Also, the locations are relatively small so there is minimal overhead support with HR and HSE remote. Finally, there is quite a bit of turnover at the General Manager and Service Sales Representative level.

pros: 4 day work week for SSRs. Interaction with customers and a job that gets you out of an office. They also offer a very good benefits package in addition to your pay. The company is very successful in business so it's profit sharing program has a very positive outlook.
cons: There are good routes and bad routes. If you get stuck on a route with little volume and lots of small out of the way stops, you end up with a long work week and a small paycheck. There are also a collection of goals you are asked to meet. Many revolve around billing a customer for a pre-determined amount of destroyed product. If your customer doesn't destroy that amount of garments or towels, you either miss your goal and get criticized, or bill your customer for something they didn't deserve.

review_title: Great management experience to help build the resume.
pros: Good Corporate Culture, Great training. Location partners are all great resources if you have them there. Great 1st time management experience in recruiting, hiring, training, retaining & promoting. Really learn to deal with different personality styles and how to manage them and influence outcomes. Big fulfillment is promoting your reps to higher positions.
cons: Very hard to maintain a successful track record with the sales rep job being such a revolving door. Your reps life span typically is 2 - 3 years tops so maintaining a strong team for the long term is not feasible. Very redundant and mundane activities that are expected and need to be tracked weekly which seem to not make sense. A constant top grading mentality only rewarding and recognizing the top 15% and looking constantly how to change the middle 70%.

review_title: Work Hard | Pay Well | Turn and Burn Sales Approach
job_title: Market Development Representative in Olathe, KS
pros: The pros of working for Cintas are the great training they provide, very competitive compensation and quality products. Everybody wants you to succeed from your peers to management to upper management.
cons: The biggest challenges are that the numbers and goals of the operations team conflict with the numbers and goals of the sales team. Constant head butting going on. I shouldn't have to sell my own company on why this new piece of business is good for all parties. They should trust that i'm making good decisions.

review_title: Want to drink the Cintas Kool-Aid?
pros: 4 Day work week, you're done with your route when you are done (some weeks I only worked 35 hours)   but wish my sales team would have grown my route - the salesmen will sell the customer anything and then the SSR is screwed to fix up the mess they made
cons: Impossible to get time off, the GM had a little mans complex and either loved you or hated you - he fired a great Marketing Manager even though he was in the top third of the company for what he got fired for and got our Direct Sales up over projections - can't take vacation during holidays, if you get a small route you could only make 300 a week.  Keep hiring outside managers who have never worked hard or run a route their entire life  Bleed blue or go home!

review_title: Great start, stress ridden and life draining
pros:
Nice benefits.
Employees are overall nice people below manager level.
Clean facilities.
Emphasis on safety and the customer.
Solid work hours.
cons: Cintas is a corporate culture most will find horrible to survive in.  It is not a positive working environment and management does not care for employees.  They insult you even more by calling you partners.  You must succumb to Cintas culture or you will be treated differently then those who do.  You are overworked and too much is expected of you individually.  Anything you tell HR in confidence is brought to your managers attention immediately.  Overall you are treated as a thing that needs to perform your tasks perfectly otherwise you will be written up Nd eventually let go.  If they hire any new drivers/SSRs it is only because they have someone in line to be fired.

job_title: New Account Coordinator in Reno, NV
pros: This position plays an important role to all the Cintas locations. They are the bridge between the sales and service department. You will learn extensive part of how the business works in the back end.  Great benefits as far as health insurance and 401k.  I received health insurance within a month of being employed! This company really values corporate culture and that is one thing I love about this company. It is also a very diverse company.
cons: Under appreciated for all the work you do.  Low Pay.  No management support (depends on your location.) Hourly rate.  Expect you do more than what your job entails.  Very little room to move up in the position unless  you want to stay in the position for more than 4 years.

review_title: You get back what you put in!
job_title: Catalog Sales Manager in Allentown, PA
pros: You get back what you put in. If you care about your performance and desire the responsibility that may greatly affect many aspects of the business Cintas is for you. You are your own manger in many respects & with that comes the expectation that you will achieve the goals necessary to grow your business and greatly increase the long term value of the company. Working with the customers & helping your partners achieve their goals is a hallmark of what is great about being a manager @ Cintas.
cons: Work/life balance but to be great many hours have to be put in & hard work is necessary.

pros:
-Promote from within
- Those without college degrees can be promoted as high up as Service Manager
- Ethical company that has a strong culture
-Good benefits
- For SSR's 4 day work week
- Great management
cons:
-We need to loosen up a little as a company. Learn to have fun and I believe we will grow even more!
- Low Pay in management positions at the local level.
- SSR's make more money than their direct Supervisor and Service Manager in some cases.
- Would like to see upper management be more engaging, friendlier, and more accessible. Feels there's a great divide between the Corporate office and the local level.

pros: Reasonable pay, great benefits, great people mostly.
cons: Forced to work even when sick due to staffing. Saw people with injuries still working because they dont have enough staff. A lot of pressure and high expectations. No support from management unless you are a favored employee and never miss a day of work. Staff are allowed to treat each other poorly with no consequences, but most of them are pretty good. They demand excellence but give you little help to acheive it. They promote work life balance in the interview, then dont support it when life happens. They may still let you work there, but make you feel horrible if you miss even a few hours of work.

job_title: SSR First Aid & Safety in Troy, MI
pros: The benefits package is very good. The Monday thru Friday work week is nice and able to drive the company work van home.
cons: Long hours expected to work. Upper management like those to drink the corporate cool aid and will make sure they are promoted faster and over the employee who has a better track record of success and the best skill set for the position. If you do your job with great success and ethically but not kissing but you will be overlooked by the under performing person who kisses management's butt.

pros: I liked the fast pace of the job and the opportunities to earn extra money through bonuses and commissions.  Other drivers were generally helpful and good people.  Over the 3 1/2 years that I was there I met a lot of great people.  I felt as if I was running my own little business center which I truly enjoyed.  My location was a rare union shop which may be slightly different from other locations - we enjoyed fair pay as well as excellent benefits.
cons: As a Route Driver (SSR) you get a little hot, dirty and smelly - but it kind of goes with the territory!  Sometimes it felt as if Management didn't like the fact that our location was unionized and seemed to hold that against us.

review_title: Great company. You can be proud to be a Cintas partner. Be sure to find your work/life balance!
pros: Cintas has great career advancement opportunities. Competitive compensation, especially for management is a very strong appeal to joining this company. perks, such as car packages, cell phone allowances, and company credit cards for expense accounts are a definite plus. Strong history of growth(38+years). Positive environment and high morale are a consistent feature at each location. Promotions and recognition are given based on proven performance. There is no weight placed on seniority, or other potential limitations. If you a motivated and hard-working, this is the career company for you.
cons: Tough work/life balance: long hours necessary/expected from managers(average 55+hrs/week). Work days begin no later than 7am and close of business at 5pm. Relatively low PTO, must be employed 5yrs to earn over 2 weeks vacation.

review_title: By Far The Worst Place to Every Work!
pros: Not a Darn Thing! This Company Sucks!
cons: Expected to work 60+ hours but only paid for 40+, Management sucks beyond belief! They will "fudge" your pay check up and then act as if they are not sure how it happened.  You will have to get up at 3am to travel for a meeting and then expected to work your full day and God if you are planning to leave take your vacation first, they Will Not pay you your earned vacation and beware, that they will only pay you your base wage and not your commission... They are so damn greedy, you can never, ever do enough to make them happy. Oh and every three months you will have to get up at 3am on a Saturday and travel up North to do inventory that you don't get paid for! This company sucks... Not one employee was happy, always complaining and back stabbing one another!

review_title: Good company to work but company is way to cheap.
pros: Excellent training programs. If you do well you are rewarded handsomely.  You are given the responsibility and the authority to take care of any issues within your scope of work.
cons: It's all about the numbers and what have you done for me lately.  If you can work in that environment Cintas is a great place to work and they reward the employees that do well.  A lot is expected of the "partners" (employees) they expect long hours and high sales numbers.  It takes a long time to effect change within the company and they are way too cheap.

review_title: Don't expect to advance here unless....
pros: Good benefits and a four day work week.
cons: No chance for advancement unless you really suck up to upper mgmt.Your numbers are a big thing and if you don't make them you are pressured to get them any way you can, ethical or unethical.Even though you are told we ( Cintas ) don't want it done by unethical means,they turn a blind eye to it when a customer calls them out on something that the ssr has done.Of course they deny any knowledge of what has happened.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Riverhead, NY
pros: I really can't think of any.
cons: I can only speak for Cintas/Cleanway in Riverhead- the Customer Service Department. This location has SERIOUS problems. I am just one of several people hired hourly recently that did not last beyond a few weeks. The "Account Mgrs" who are supposed to train you are nasty, condescending and so worried about their jobs that they purposely make you feel like you do not belong there. They are a bunch of unprofessional kids who inappropriately do nothing but talk about how drunk they were over the weekend. They are supposed to be "Corporate" but yet they walk around in flip-flops and barefoot in the office. Not-to-mention the disgusting perverted conversations they would have and the cursing you have to listen to daily. If Corporate actually heard any of this most of the department would be fired.

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Toronto, ON
pros: Decent benefits. Colleagues are great.
cons:
As a service sales rep, you are over worked and not paid over time. Many reps work more than the max 44 hour workweek and are not paid OT. Management is poor. They also treat you poorly if you get hurt on the job. They want you back asap because they don't have the resources to cover your route if you're off work for any period of time. 
I can go on ...but the 20 word minimum in this comment section won't suffice.

pros:
Hard work pays off here for sure. If you want to wait around and have things handed to you, this is not for you.  

Every move is considered a promotion.  The pay bands allow differences in pay throughout a job title so more experienced or longer serving will garner more pay than a new hire. 

Plethora of volunteer opportunities to give back to the local community.  They are very engaged with having a great name brand throughout the country with this.
cons:
You work hard, so does everyone else around you. What would be considered Rockstar Status at another company is an average work day or pace here.  

KPIs change every year, not always up, sometimes just completely different based on what the company wants to see. Makes sense, just hard to plan for.

pros: Front line workers are mostly engaged, personable, and care about doing a good job.
cons: Supervisors generally do not work well together, and senior management (Directors) in Ohio are micromanagers and over-involved with day to day operations, creating distractions and preventing core work from being done effectively.

pros:
The company has great leadership and rewards people who are driven, want to develop their professional careers and are upwardly mobile. 

Cintas has a great culture with an even clearer story. Those who wish to know about the company's history, the company's future and financial outlook need only ask. This company is an open book and loves making sure employees at every level of the organization are engaged and aware of how their role impacts the principal objective of the organization.
cons: Although the company rewards hard working, dedicated, driven people, it can also be a stressful place to work. Cintas calls their drive for continuous improvement "positive discontent" which can be a good thing except for when people demand perfection, at all times.

review_title: Cintas: Could be great if the pay were truly comensurate.
pros: Great benefits package with 401(k) and stock purchasing options.
cons: Pay is dismal and does not take into consideration education level.  Employees with no degree, Associate's degree, and MBA all start out at same pay rate which is tough to justify.  Education is pushed by senior managers for advancement, but the company is not willing to offer tuition assistance or repayment.  When education is completed there is no real recognition given or increased opportunity for advancement.

review_title: Solid, but stuck in the past.
job_title: Six Sigma Black Belt in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Stable company. Competitive, but median-level, salary and benefits. Great people.
cons:
Dress code and grooming policies are stuck in the past. Formal business attire required and white or blue dress shirts strongly preferred. Beards are not allowed, only mustaches and goatees. The latter being a newer policy change. You must shave daily. 

Very conservative, Republican company. Executives are a major donor to the Republican party. 

Vacation policy is not competitive. Two weeks of annual vacation time until five years. Three weeks of vacation until 15 years. Maxes out at four weeks of vacation after year 15.

pros: Money is good, work life balance is good if you are disciplined, car package, cell phone, insurance all paid for, selling a superior product in Sig Series
cons: You get rewarded for doing the wrong thing, screwing over the customer and even Cintas. over-sell, get paid (basically steal) high commissions and then screw the service dept. Great job if you have no soul or decency....but if you want to run a real business and do sales the right way, where you work hard for sales/referrals not just banging out sales up and down the street, go somewhere else...

pros: Pay is fine if you work 60+ hours a week to sell enough
cons: Be prepared to drive 60k miles a year. Your territory can make you money or tear you down. You will only “stay green” with your sales numbers if you sell large target accounts. Customers try to quit constantly because of crazy price increases. If you are a large company you will be taken advantage of! Route drivers can and will add things to your invoice without you ever knowing! I’ve seen tons of people who are paying $50 for 12 small rolls of toilet paper! Book price is $16 when you start. They call it pricing fairness but it is by far the most greedy thing I’ve ever seen. One of my hotels received an increase in their bill from $200 a week to $365 a week! No additional services added just a price increase! It happens every year.

job_title: Outside Sales Representative in Chicago, IL
pros: Great Benefits, Great way to cut your teeth, and sharpen your skills in business
cons:
Recent acquisition by Cintas has resulted in chaos, misinformation, empty promises, and dismal morale.

Death Row inmates are more optomistic about their futures than "GK Legacy partners" with no discernable job duties, training schedule, but we have 90 days to complete training, and hit sales goal to be a permanent Cintas employee... If only they would divulge that number to us.

Total breakdown of trust and communication, Cintas leadership is as shady as their self-serving,  crooked service contracts.

Yeah, I said it!

review_title: Jump Start 2016 with a career at Cintas!
pros: The people and the culture.  I interviewed with a dozen companies before choosing Cintas and from day 1, the people and the culture - the SPIRIT - stood out to me.  In 7 years, I have not been disappointed.  We are a customer focused organization, and it is fun to come to work with all of my Partners working towards a common goal -- Exceed the Customer Expectations!
cons: Its hard work!  This is not a place to work if you are not interested in investing in the customer, your development, your partners, and the big picture.  We are looking for passionate people who want to make a difference!

pros: I love my coworkers, but we bonded in a WW2 in the trenches sort of way.
cons:
Pay is not reflective of the amount of work expected.
Corporate is atrocious.
Not a lot of vacation time.
Lied about what the job entails (for example, I was not told that I would also be the receptionist and the office assistant until after I'd accepted and left my previous job).
Management is extremely overworked, as are the SSR's and pretty much everyone that is salaried.
They chose to buy G&K instead of getting their own house in order first, and so the incoming merger is already a mess.
No upward potential (every manager since I've been there has been hired from the outside).
The turnover is high. Except one other employee, in 2 years I am the only remaining original office worker. And the SSRS go quicker than that, And I don't blame them. Almost everyone here is looking for another job.
I could go on.

review_title: Not all branches are created equal
job_title: Outside Sales Representative in Pittsfield, MA
pros: Best overall health, dental, vision I have ever seen.  Good starting, they promote from within.
cons: From my understanding this may just be the branch but horrible, sleezy management.  Would promise certain perks and not deliver, or purposely hold your performance back from achieving.  Based off of branch numbers would literally cut expense checks in half and say we had to deal with it.  If coming from an outside recruiter, would tell candidates to lie and shake the recruiter or they wouldn't be hired.  During my 1 year there they secretly hired 2 candidates after they had them ditch their recruiter so as to not have to pay the recruiter.  Like I said, may just be one branch's culture but very dishonest management.

pros: Benefits are better then most places, got to take vehicle home (standard for my occupation), sadly that's all I can say good about this company.
cons: I was a long time employee for the fire protection division,  I got to see how bad Cintas abused their employees and how much the customer got defrauded with bogus charges. They are very dishonest and will do whatever it takes to make the numbers, from charging the customer for parts that didn't get installed to tripling the cost of parts to make up for bad sale quotes. Employment law violations are common, they push safety meeting after safety meeting  but when real  safety issues come up during a project nobody wants to hear about it since it affects their profit, in other words they just want the signature from the employees to comply with OSHA and to get a better rate from their insurance company. They do not care about employees, letting go of a great employee two weeks after losing his child was a sign to me. BEWARE!

pros:
- Control of your own route
- Benefits / vacation
- Contests and perks
- 4 day work week
- Good co-workers that are willing to help
cons:
- Virtually everything else 

If you are a facility services or uniform SSR, you will be exposing yourself to dirty and hazardous work conditions that include unclean and often unsafe products and environments. 

Partners  often  work upwards 13+ hours during the 4-day work week. They automatically remove 30 minutes of pay for lunch breaks, but you rarely have time to even take one. 

Base pay + commission is often lower than expected and bonuses are not guaranteed. Training pay is often better depending on the route.

review_title: Depends on the leadership of the location
pros: Great benefits.  Good, down to earth people at the location level who work hard to get the job done.  Pay for performance.  Great communication throughout the country.  Safety is top of priority for this company.  They truly care about employee partners going home in good health every night.
cons: Very administrative.  They purchase systems for their cheapness, not how well they perform and support the employee partners and managers.  They promote too many people to quickly.  Pay is on the cheap side for managers.  If you want to be paid fairly, go elsewhere.  You can tell the co. is based in the consertive Mid west when it comes to dress code and certain policies.

review_title: Nice job , nice hours make it your own
job_title: Service Sales Representative in Union, NJ
pros: Money, and bonuses every third week of month, great co workers, and customers make it your own!
cons: sales quota weekly, garbage sales reps cheating customers, and managers not being held accountable all the while messing over the drivers and production when things go bad, managers and people who sell accounts  do not take responsibility, management sucked!in addition to price increases with no warnings to drivers or customers!

review_title: It was a mistake accepting this job
pros: My original response to this was "zero Pros" but this site makes you type 20 words so here they are.
cons: Management is atrocious, best to just forget about working hard and enhance your butt kissing skills because that is the only way to get anywhere here,  new trucks go to who kisses up the most and not to the most deserving driver, management is to busy goofing off half the time to get the product you need to be successful on your routes or for the warehouse workers to do an effective job, most nights loaders/unloaders had to stay till 2am waiting on product to come up on shuttles because management didn't do their job in making sure it got on the trucks to be sent to your location,  do not listen to the lies about promoting from within because I promise you they will not, you will work your butt off and then see people pulled in off the street to fill a position that belongs to you, at Cintas you will be a voice that is not heard.

pros: Benefits. Able to transfer to other locations. Pto.
cons: Never seen such incompetence on a management level and excuses are made, lies told, and upper mgmt is turtle slow to react. Constant harrasement to partners to achieve outrageous numbers. Ridiculously high l/r goals. Overloaded work schedule and accounts. Catalogue pay still at 8% and hasn't changed in over 10yrs. Max pay increase is 4%, but you'll NEVER hit it (by design). Mgmt is reactive to customers although they preach being proactive. Turnover is extremely high for Svc Mrs and supervisors. What does that tell you. Scotty, you and Spartan have to part ways in order to maintain quality help and pay your people accordingly. Get rid of the good ole boy network and diversify your mgmt staff with more minorities, especially in top levels, and not just a token here and there. PAY YOUR SSR'S better!!! Reward them better as well!!!

review_title: Hated the whole year I worked there
pros: I guess the best reason to work there would be because in the begining they will make you feel very important. Strong Marketing. Decent starting pay.
cons: The corporate culture is awful. As a woman sales rep, I was expected to wear short skirts and smile pretty. The possiblity of ever being promoted to management was not in the cards. Its a mans world there and a woman is never taken seriously. They recruited me with total BS promises of opportunity and instead quicky saw that I was sold a bag of beans. Micro-Managment is the standard and the manangers that are doing it have no clue what its like to be a top producing outside rep. They are closed minded, cant get outside the box, and turn down new accounts if they dont fit exactly into the "perfect customer" seneraio. They need to open thier eyes and see all the missed opportunties!

review_title: Great company to start your career but limited opportunity for advancement
pros: Stable company with strong culture, above average benefits and good compensation plan. Company offers great initial training programs and encourages professionalism and high ethics. Good company with a strong foundation and values at a corporate level but sometimes gets lost at the local level.
cons: Company sells itself on diversity and internal growth throughout the hiring process. Both are superficial promises.  Limited opportunity for advancement. Most leadership positions are held by white males. Upper management makes false promises and lacks follow through. Follow through creates distrust and disengaged employees. Employee morale is low and most are just going through the motions. Upper management does not appreciate the value diverse employees have to offer. Most promotions are given to 'yes men" without initiative or proactive problem solving skills.

review_title: FNA- please don't even apply here
pros:
Co-workers (SOME) 
401k benefits are good
cons:
Chaotic management
Micromanaging
Lack of staff
Lack of training
No morale
Bad management 
No incentives
Low pay
Overworked
Have to work there a year to get sick and vacation time 

One last thing: it's all about politics there. If you can succeed at manipulation and lying, then you can make it there. They tell you to be positive, yet they put multiple projects on you that they expect to be finished ASAP. You're yelled at if those projects are not finished because you get 20 other projects to do. They claim they distribute the work, but don't know how many steps the work takes. You know what they say about assuming?

pros: Freedom and decent training.  Avg incone for reps up and running 120k. Uniform reps in top 3rd of their region making 150 - 210 k gross.  Complex and simple sales.  Plenty of room to advance and compete.
cons: Not very up to date with technology as a company.  Can be very micromanaged depending on your boss.  Driving the sale internally is more difficult than need be and onboarding process of new customers is weak with so many people in the equation.

review_title: Beware: Managers Ethics are Lacking or Non-Existent
pros: There is no Pro that is worth the stress and mental instability you will have working here
cons: Micromanagement is out of control in this company.  Managers aren't accountable for their own deadlines or mistakes.  Supervisor's and team members are given all the workload for any mistake or deadline missed by management, which is all of the time.  Deadlines are missed and papers are forged or backdated just to stay on top of all of the missed deadlines. The only way to become a manager and be successful here is to throw away any ethics you have.

review_title: Good career path and earning potential for young professionals.
pros: Great opportunity to earn what you work for in professional positions. (Big bell curve, but performance = big $$)  Sales careers pay much better than competitors, and other business services companies.  Great career path for sales professionals.
cons: New organizational chart created sales/operations silos.  Lack of communication between the two is hurting ability to adapt in changing market climate.  Horrible, outdated operating systems to manage businesses.  Too much manual reporting.  Information is constantly repackaged 100 different ways. (Inefficient)

review_title: Dishonest company parading as a team with their "partners"
pros: Drivers are for the most part honest and try to do their jobs
cons:
This company pretends to have corporate culture but it definitely does NOT. The Edmonton branch lacks in honesty. They try to show that they value their "partners" but it's all a SHOW. They have people in administration who have completely inappropriate attitudes. The drivers try to do their jobs to the best of their ability...with what they are given, which isn't very much. I wish I had warning before I stepped in that god forsaken place. Here's YOUR warning..stay for away unless you want to be miserable and put up with management who have their heads up so far up their own end they can't see day light.

As far as Customer Service goes, they have a lot of issues with that department as well. MANY customers are unsatisfied and complain to the drivers on a consistent basis.

review_title: Cintas can be great or incredible frustrating
pros: Great benefits and 401k, car plan and structured commissions (for sales). They also have an extensive training program that can be both challenging and rewarding.
cons: Sales goals are so high they are nearly unachievable. While at Cintas there wasn't a single representative on presidents club pace due to the numbers they want you to achieve. While at cintas they also lowered commission multiples or found other unique ways to pay less commission in several occasions.

pros: If you have the right partners, they will help develop you and get your name out there. You can also transfer to other locations, if there is a job opening.
cons: Been working with the company for several years and you work long hours. It doesn't matter how long you have been with the company when it comes to pay. There are "ceilings" for a lot of jobs. You have to make time for life outside of work and learn to say no to working. They tend to focus more on Management Trainees and less on partners that did not come in under that program. They can pass you up for a MT just because of the title.

review_title: Management at many locations are dishonest and two faced!
pros: Good Benefits, steady work, newer equipment.
cons: General Managers are allowed to rule like a dictator. No local HR at many locations. Always keeps the warehouse short staffed in order to boost profits.  Management does not enforce the same corporation policies for everyone, favoritism is very prevalent!!  Location GM's are worried to death about a Union Vote!  Allows the Service Rep's to run the location. Employees are afraid to complain about the GM to the HR department because HR always takes sides with the management and the employee is then let go for some reason.

pros: Company pays for your car allowance, gas, and insurance. You have freedom instead of being stuck in an office all day. You also have unlimited prospects as any company can buy what Cintas sells.
cons: Micromanagement from the very top all the way to the plant level. Extremely corporate conservative. In a time where most employers are much more relaxed on attire, Cintas sales reps are expected to be in full suit daily. Also be prepared for long hours. Everyday the earliest anything starts is 730. All the pros get in around 645 though. The work day still ends at 5-6 though.

review_title: The honest Truth.... if you can work there, you can work anywhere- but look somewhere else.
pros: The pay and benefits are the only perks, but, you defnitely have to work to get the pay... unless you work at a location that gets a lot of call ins.
cons: You are supposed to eat, sleep and breathe Cintas.  They micro manage to death, to the point of reporting every hour how many phonecalls you made, and you have to log everything in the system so they can scrutinize what you are doing every second of every day.  I see them eventually going to GPS tracking devices, honestly- they are thinking about laptops for each sales person (i'm sure they would track you)

pros: Humbling experience, especially for a recent college graduate. There's nothing like graduating from college, feeling like you deserve to make a certain amount of money, and then having to work the company from the ground up.  I learned so much about myself and I was truly treated like a manager with my opinions being valued and accepted. You also get awesome leadership experience leading people twice and even three times your age.
cons: The management trainee program overall lacks structure.  You may remain in rotations longer than planned (or skip rotations altogether) because of the location's needs.  This can be great if you find an area you love, or less than ideal if it's an area you don't.

review_title: Work hard Play when you have time.
pros: Career development and growth potential they provide a great platform for you to hone your skills.  Cintas is a strong company that rewards partners based on performance and not tenure.  The future is bright despite the slow economy, that will eventually turn around.  Cintas is a cash company and will always be driven by its customers and its ability to make profits by exceeding customers expectations.  When Cintas took over our company we saw a dramatic improvement and structure that helped all the partners excel beyond what they thought was possible I could not be happier about my choice to work for Cintas.
cons: The amount of hours you will put in.  If you are a non stop go getter you will never take time off unless you are made to by management.

review_title: Its a corporation, what where you expecting
pros: Benefits, 4 day work week, you are left alone to run your route
cons: Raises are laughable, whether you are dominating the location or in risk of losing your job, expect between 10-25 cents a year.   If you can sell, and sell well, you will do ok.  My problem is, that I would not buy or rent  these products, so I am not going to try to convince you too.  I am not going to spend all day explaining how things work here at Cintas.  I will say, please speak to drivers before you apply.  We are all over the cities, just look around and you will see one of us.  Stop us and ask us questions, we dont mind

job_title: FS Sales Representative in Seattle, WA
pros: Good people good culture, if you are what they call the Cintas Way meaning your beliefs, culture, personality, integrity, etc. is what Cintas believe in, then they will find a spot for you within the company that makes sense. For example you spend a few years in sales but then dont want to do sales, they will find a spot for you if you are the Cintas way.
cons: The new spot they find for you may be a pay cut or increase depending on the position. also, if you are the Cintas Way then they will do almost everything to save you but if you do stay there is a chance you can become just a number because you tried to leave and then stayed.

pros: There isn't a single positive thing I can say about this company
cons: Frat mentality. If you aren't part of the "cool" crowd, you will get ignored and your training will be non-existent. Management and HR coordinate efforts to eliminate excellent workers purely on the basis of them not liking the person. I saw them trump up policy violation accusations and force very, very good people out the door. Work/life balance is a joke. I was told 45 hours in my interview process and never worked less than 60.

pros: Consistent hours and pay, great place to start if you want more office experience
cons: They don't train people very well. I work in Accounts receivable and they were more concerned with the policies and procedures than training me how to do my job. There is too much gossip in my department and everyone talks about everyone even the managers. Overall, I felt uncomfortable and the higher ups have no idea what's going on  because they are never there. It would be a good place to work if they got rid of some of the people that start too much trouble and replaced them with people that actually want the company to thrive.

review_title: SSR= hard work but great work schedule
pros: 4 day work week! Off weekends! Commissions at my location are awesome so pay is great! Business is booming here so I have all the volume I can handle.
cons: My location definitely has issues with departments working together. Production vs. Service. Ultimately it seems the GM does not want to hear what we need help with, just tells us how we need to do our jobs better. I think this causes most of the tension between SSRs and production because we don't feel like he cares, though we are "the face of the company"

job_title: Facilities Account Executive in Providence, RI
pros: Training and understanding how to walk into businesses and gain information.  Other companies like to hire because of the training you receive.  Get the training and then get out.
cons: No respect for you as a person.  5am 6am 7am meetings-late night.  Doesn't matter.  If you work at cintas, cintas is your life, nothing else.  Drink the cool aid here or get out.
