The management here are a bunch of under educated guys that do not have any idea what being a professional is.  They read it in books and then preach.  Its a revolving door at this company

review_title: I learned a ton about fortune 100 companies while employed 7 years at Cintas
job_title: SSR, Sanis, STC in Eugene, OR
pros: Stable and steady, progressive but conservative, organized and consistent. Kind of wish it had worked out after all the departments and people I got to learn from and grow with.
cons: Pressure cooker. Numbers obsessed. Pay plans at the time were manipulated by 2007 recession and it's fallout. Got tired of having endless propaganda shoved down my throat.

pros: Huge on safety. If you work for the right location you will be treated great. Always having competitions to earn extra money or other items.
cons: They expect you to do 12 hours of work in a 8 hour day. The location I was at, the GM cared more about money and not enough about the employees. How hard is it to say hi to your employees, ask how their day was and say keep up the good work. ( I am a supervisor, so the GM doesn't need to talk to me be nice to see him care about non management employees.

pros: Great experience to have on your resume. You really get to learn the ins and outs of corporate life. You get B2B experience and learn how to deal with upset customers as well as very satisfied customers. If you can stay in this position for more than a year, you shouldn't have a problem moving up in the company into either a management position or sales.
cons: Expected to work more than 60 hrs a week. Not much of a work/family life balance. The Service Sales Rep Supervisor position is known throughout the company as, "THE WORST JOB IN CINTAS". If you can hack it, many doors will open.

job_title: FS Sales Representative in Hayward, CA
pros: The training was impeccable, and never ending.  The company really sucks you in and you start to believe what they are doing is for the good of the consumer.
cons: Turn over was 100% in our office, no one stayed longer than a year without doing something that would seal their numbers and they couldn't be put on a probationary sales goal.  Everyone was written up and put on probation for their number, even though in the bad economy they raised the number and hired reps, limiting the territories.  Very cut throat, everyone out for himself, lots of fake, overly excited managers to pretend you believe the stuff coming out of their mouths.  Just an overall unhealthy work enviroment.

review_title: Great company, great benefits, and great culture!
pros: The best local GM in our group! 4 day work week. Good benefits......medical, dental, vision. etc. Always looking to promote within (if you want and do a good job), managers will help you get to where you want to go. Job security. Superb corporate culture; very few companies have humble, professional and ethical higher ranking officials like Cintas. Bonus potentials with performance incentives. Great local partners (Employees).
cons: Lack of communication of local management (everything is always a surprise). Manual labor mixed with professional is physically and mentally draining. Long work hours very little work life balance.

pros: The pros of working at Cintas are the culture and the pay. Coming straight out of college, all of the positions pay very well and as an overall whole, the culture is to include everyone in all decisions. The MT program sounds great when you're at a career fair, but once you've learned how Cintas works as a whole, it looses it's glamour.
cons: Cintas is a service oriented company, so every day there is going to be a major issue to deal with. There is constant fighting between departments and often times the MT gets pulled into every direction. The hours are long and expectations are unrealistic at times. There has been numerous days where I've had to cover a route, cover check in, and then help load and unload trucks. Not many days go by that I don't work at least a 14 hour shift.

job_title: Production Supervisor | Management Trainee in Covington, LA
pros: The 18 month Management Training Program that Cintas offers is a great way to jump start your career. Leadership rotations in sales, production, service, administration, and business operations allow you to become a well rounded business professional. The program also includes obtaining six sigma green belt certification and plenty of process improvement and project management opportunities.
cons: No cons that I can think of. The only reason I left is because I was offered an amazing position closer to home that I couldn't pass up.

pros:
Benefits
Pay based on performance
Performance leads to opportunites
cons: The higher you move up in the company, the more it is about who you know.  The company is going away from takng care of their people.   More focused on numbers, policies, procedures, etc.  They do a poor job of rolling out the changes within the organization.   The people involved in making the decisions for things to changes are in the corporate office and do not really understand what really happens at the local facilities.   Pay plans changes yearly.   They are rolled out a quarter into the year.   They are late to pay you the money you have earned.

pros: Company has requirement that associates must participate with the customer reps. Depending on your level at the company, one must go with a truck driver route and visit with customer. I enjoyed this, but many did not like it.  In some jobs, an sales office partnership would count.
cons:
Cintas has a dress code that no cotton blends in material can be worn at work. Men must wear long sleeve shirts with ties. No flip flops, or gym shoes. The process was that any employee could bring the code up to an HR rep. The rep would review and bring up to your manager as a warning.  
Name tags had to be worn above waist. These identified contractors from employees by tag color and everyone knew your name. Tag could be pro or con.

review_title: Would be a great job if it payed better.
job_title: Utility IV in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Because job turnover tends to be high in some departments, it's easy to get your foot in the door. If you make an effort and are nice to the bosses, usually you can move into a job you like better and possibly get promoted.
cons: Pay is low, even for "unskilled" labor. Most factory workers I know make more than I do. No matter how long you've worked there, hourly workers only get five "emergency" days (basically, sick days) per year. Managers are always stressed.

job_title: Route Service Representative in Greensboro, NC
pros: Cintas is a good company depending on your managers and supervisors. excellent entry level pay if you can handle customers well.  Excellent job to have on your resume if you wish to leave.
cons:
you will work harder than you ever have. The more you sell on your route the more you have to service, you can make alot of money but no where near as much as the managers make by just sitting in the office.

Way to much *politics*. owner of company is old fashion so no facial hair or anything that says culture. Wouldnt hire a great salesperson all because he had dreads.

review_title: 23 Torlake Crescent - No work life balance - Very poor management
pros: I can't think of one unfortunately
cons: Awful company culture/management. No work life balance. You're just a number on the wall.

job_title: First Aid & Safety Service Sales Representative in Cleveland, OH
pros:
Pay is mid scale, vehicle is furnished in some cases, nice with high gas prices.  Great retirement plan--but you will  not be here to collect on it.

Long hours don't bother me if the pay is commensurate--it was not.
cons:
If you are over 35, keep your resume handy.  You will never prove it, but they don't want middle aged or experienced folks.

No support from management for sales people.  If you lose an account because management doubled price, it's you fault.  

This place is a revolving door--they actually brag that 85% of the people working for Cintas today, will not be here next year.

All communication from management is one way--"Do it", "My way or the highway".  the sales people who actually talk to the customers are not allowed to have an opinion.

Whatever you do, do not get sick!

pros: One of my favorite things about this company is that management, from the Plant Manager down to the Team Lead, will jump in and get their hands dirty doing grunt work, if it means helping out the regular Partners. The benefits are incredible and the starting pay is SO much better than other companies.
cons: The Lavatec bag system that Cintas uses is outdated and breaks down pretty regularly. Aside from that, the only negative thing I can honestly say is that the heat is almost unbearable during the summer. However, the company buys the best fans available and are currently trying to install an industrial AC unit to keep the loading bay as cool as possible.

review_title: Good job. Leadership team and executive management need to sit down with front line partners more often.
pros: 4 day work week is the best. Benefits are ok. You must be a peak performer to get your managers attention.
cons:
There aren't any current opportunities for advancement at this time in our location. During a service meeting, we (SSR'S) asked what is the next step from a SSR/CRT, they replied, "STC however, we do not have any plans on opening a STC position at this location." 
The only manager showing up in the mornings are the warehouse manager. The leadership team doesn't even notice a problem when we are shorted over 200 mats for the current days delivery!

pros: we have most of the holidays off
cons: NOT A PARTNER COMPANY AT ALL .

review_title: The good the bad and the dirty laundry.
pros: The Corp Backing of a big company with the small business feel of each of the separate locations.  There are many opportunities for advancement because of all the new businesses Cintas is involved in.  The rental division is fairly stagnant but if you take a look at some of the ancilary businesses like First Aid and Safety, Document Management, and Fire Division there is a ton of growth in these Sectors.
cons: They ask a lot of their employees and don't always treat everyone fairly.  Sometimes the people who just sit around and delegate their resposibilities get rewarded while the employees who do all the work get left by the wayside.

review_title: Best job I ever had - LOVE this company!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Corporate culture is not just on paper - it's meant to be used by every employee to drive success. Excellent policies that are available to everyone (no secrets there). Career paths are there for driven, ambitious employees.
cons: No budget at all for anything. We had to do the job literally with nothing many times over. Cintas prides itself on its Spartan view of business which does contribute to its financial soundness, but it can be taken a little too far at times. Computer system outdated with no plans to upgrade. Pay very low compared to market. Corporate office in Ohio is a little out of touch with national locations - visits by corporate management would go a long way.

pros: Corporate Culture and Character.  Nice to work for the best in the business that was always looking at ways to provide better service to their customers.  Stock Price and equity stake for certain positions.
cons: Executive Leadership is completely detached from the field.  All about compliance and what looks good on paper.  Company executives have really lost touch with the field and don't live the corporate culture which is the best thing about Cintas and what has made them successful

pros: You get paid every week
cons:
Lacking of training
Micro managing by upper mangement
Several employees issued warnings about the job, employee and management with in 1st week on the job.
Minimal vacation time
Medical and dental benefits are very expensive for a couple or family.

review_title: Not a glamorous job. Good, honest hard work with fair pay.
pros: It's a good company that has been around for a long time. Most of the jobs in the company are safe during economic hard times. You don't have somebody looking over your shoulder all day. You basically just go to work and take care of your customers. You really only see management in the mornings and when you get back in from your day.
cons: I wouldn't work there if your goal is to advance quickly. If you would like to become a manager you pretty much have to start as a manager trainee. It is pretty much not going to happen for a very long time, if at all, if you are a regular employee.

review_title: Face of the company, yeah right!
job_title: Service Training Coordinator in Memphis, TN
pros: many locations, which gives you an opportunity to transfer or get a promotion, good prestigious company, as a whole, to work for
cons: stressfull, no home life as a STC, glorified route skipper, on route all the time,  don't manage anything, terrible position

review_title: This place only keeps C level talent, the better talent leaves once it figures out the score
pros: medical is above average in this day and age,  you  get paid weekly so it feels like you are doing better than you are.
cons: this place makes money by being sure it does not give one extra cent to its employees.  If you love annual 2% raises and being bullied by executive management, this is the place for you.  If you love mediocrity and lowered expectations  why working hard not smart, you will go far at Cintas.

review_title: Great first sales job, with extremely high expectations and terrible work life balance.
job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Orlando, FL
pros: Opportunity for great first job money. Great sales training, good people and culture. Cintas sales people are the most highly trained and driven in the world. Good opportunity for advancement.
cons: Highest priced products on the market with lowest quality. Cintas does everything but does nothing great. The systems and rules differ from location to location. Billing and technology way behind times.

job_title: Sales Service Representative in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
Ability to grow your route and make more commission.
Manage and control over 150 accounts you are responsible for; teaching you management skills.
cons:
Long days.
Routes can be out of order, experience on the job comes with your ability to learn your route.
Missing product on truck due to shortages, t hat will negatively affect your paycheck and happy customers.

review_title: Good coworkers but the money isn't worth the stress
pros: Decent pay, Great GM, Decent Supervisors & Managers. Nice office staff. Independent most of the day
cons: Work loads constantly increase, Many extra hours depending on different circumstances, Extremely stressful, Physically demanding (but to be expected), Never have customer products that you need. Did I say stressful? This job will wear you down over time mentally and physically. Not worth the money. Very high turn over rate. many more cons but you get the picture. This is my honest review I hold no grudges.

pros: The benefits were affordable.
cons:
Discriminatory management, preferential treatment towards certain employees over others. Don't let them fool you, it's not about service or the customer.. it's aaallll about SALE$. Thankfully I had no sales goals to hit, but the 30 SSR's that did at my location were under constant stress to sell for profit.  They put up a good front, like they 'care' about you as a 'partner'... I was fired for something I didn't do, without a warning, with ZERO contact from Corporate HR for my statement. I worked the roles of both myself and my Office Supervisor while she was on maternity leave; I got NO recognition, let alone compensated like I should have been for making collections calls, for example. 
Ultimately, not worth the time and effort I put in.

pros:
The coolest Service Reps
Believe it or not, local management is not bad, they know corparate is full of ... and can hardly look at us with a straight face, I'm sure every single one of them can't wait to find something else.
cons:
- 4 day work can hardly be considered a plus, I'm dead after my 4th day of work
- this industry is the shadiest I've ever been part of. 
- 4 price increases a year is NOT what the customer wants, it's on the edge of criminal and if I'm not mistaken called price gouging.
- Management argues that everybusinness have price increase, big BS, PI are about 30% at times even more. Put that in the analogy of any businness expense one might have.
- Horrible Corporate Culture, calling everybody partners does us no good. 
- you can tottaly see the difference between reviews and positions, the rest of the company has close to no idea what goes on in the front. It's uggly.

review_title: Good to have on  a resume, but don't stay too long
pros: Decent pay, good to have on your resume
cons: Knee-jerk response to operating business.  Management is living in a fantasy land and plans business without hard data to support goals. Once the plan doesn't work they shuffle leaders around like musical chairs.  Poor leadership has led to having to sell some of the most profitable divisions. They make promises to customers they don't intend to keep and have fallen from grace with some of there best accounts .  Most unethical company I've ever worked for.

pros: Cintas allows you the opportunity to advance within the company.  Their compensation package is fairly good especially if you're seeking employment right out of college.
cons: Like many other large corporations, Cintas is strictly about money and nothing else.  I was highly successful within the organization but my career was derailed because of one very poor manager (who was promptly transferred within weeks after my exile).  They often promote their "conservative" values and often push their employees to believe in their political causes and stress how important it is to vote accordingly.

pros: Typically a strong base pay with perks of a car package and quarterly bonuses.
cons: They tend to hire young (20 somethings,white males in sales (s they like to think since men are the "bread winners & if you're married even better if your wife doesn't work…they have you by the balls so you are not tempted to quit.) but do hire if you are visually appealing (i.e.beautiful and a size 4) "girls".  Male dominated company throughout the entire organizations.  They have their "token" female heads in few positions and minorities mostly behind the scenes.  RIGHT wing company.

pros:
*Corporate Culture and the "family' mentality is nice.
*Pay for Supervisor is Decent.
*Treat Hourly workers with respect and trust your experience over your pay rate.
cons:
*Was not trained for Position.
*Work expected from Production Supervisors left little room for a family life.
*Supervisor made little to no time to discuss issues with me. 
*As a supervisor I was constantly undermined by my boss, the Plant Manager. My Partners would go to the Production Supervisor and complain and behind my back he would do what THEY wanted and ask me to explain myself. He would go tell them to do things that was WRONG (or change something without telling me and wonder why I don't know as it is "my Stockroom") or move them without my consent them complain why my line was backed up or why I was behind. 
*Slow to hire ANYONE. At one point I was missing 9 PEOPLE from 23 and when I stated this as the main reason why everything was behind I was "Making Excuses".

pros: Great but expensive benefits, 4 day workweek, you are left alone if you do your job, depending on the route pretty easy hours
cons: High pressure sales tactics. Most management out for there own bonuses. Always feel like I have to protect customers from the company. Sales reps will pull sketchy stuff and leave you to clean up the mess.

pros: You get what you put in. Good pay if you are willing to work hard, a lot of different career paths within Cintas for those that excel. Management wants you to climb the ladder and will Work with you to reach those goals.
cons: Large companies tend to make policies and procedures that cater to the least common denominator. If one person on the team struggles, even those that are surpassing goals have meetings about meetings to ensure the weakest link doesn’t break. Reminiscent of no child left behind. Those that work hard and consistently  surpass goals can lose productivity.

review_title: Cintas a great place to work, but little work-life balance.
pros: Great opportunity for advancement.  Action packed workplace.  Cintas acquired my company, which was more of aquality/ customer oriented company.  Cintas provides a lot of incentives, to make sure your money matches your performance.  You can move up in the ranks here faster than any other company I know of.
cons: As a manager, very little personal life time.  Expect to work 60 hours a week in upper management.  Cintas is much more growth-profit oriented.  If you are not hitting your numbers, do not expect to have your position much longer.  You have to constantly perform.  There are not many long-term managers.  The good ones are promotred and the bad ones are fired or demoted.

review_title: Cintas is a great company with world-class training.
pros: Cintas is a company that provides excellent training for new and tenured sales representatives.  The people hired by the Cintas sales organization are generally very high energy and eager to learn and absorb information.  Cintas is very good at providing continuous training to ensure best practice is achieved.
cons: There are too many changes that occur with very little heads-up or explanations.  Company and managers may at times set out false expectations in terms of career advancement.  This is with relations to territory management and assignment.  There are many gray areas between Uniforms and Facility Services divisions, which can cause repeated uncomfortable situations.

review_title: Cintas is the worst company that I have ever worked for
job_title: Sales Service Representative in Cincinnati, OH
pros: 4 day work week, benefits, paycheck, HR online system. You will need the 3 days off to recover from the 4 day work week.
cons: Long hours do not match pay.  Old vehicles with no a/c!. Very Very labor intensive and dirty. Salaried SSR's have to use a time clock. Overtime pay is paid at less than regular time  Time clock is used as a tool by management to justify an unrealistic schedule.  The faster and more efficient you become the more they add on. Flawed system(lost garments, wrong garments and misc. charges)  encourages and forces SSR's to be less than honest with customers on a daily basis.

review_title: Great Customers, Terrible Office and Management Staff
job_title: First Aid & Safety Service Sales Representative
pros: Customers are great and appreciate the service and products. There's a lot of freedom as long as you're seeing all your customers and hitting your numbers. The pay is decent for the work and the skills needed.
cons: Work-life balance is non-existent. You're expected to "work as long as you need to get your work done." You are reliant on the warehouse and office staff, and in my case, both are ineffective at their jobs. Also, upper management doesn't realize that what may be an effective policy in Ohio may not work in other places (i.e., not every company wants tablets).

review_title: Nice start to get to somewhere better
job_title: First Aid &Amp; Safety Service Sales Representative in Columbus, OH
pros: Cintas is a reputable company with solid structure and great training. They give you good goals to hit and have reasonable expectations to hit your KPI's (what you're measured on)
cons:
Quite honestly you don't make enough for the work you put in, jumping to another company after Cintas is a step up. Even if you max out your commission potential and bonuses you will find that you can make more if you move into more of a sales role, especially with other companies.

Another downside is personal days off, there is typically only one week PTO when you start and you are expected to make up for time not running your route before and after you get back.

pros: The best reason to work for Cintas Document is the atmosphere of a smaller company with the backing of a corporation. Every day my immediate supervisor give constructive feedback to help me succeed. They are always available, knowledgeable, and eager to keep their employees happy. In fact, keeping their employees happy is their goal. Every review I do is centered around the mantra of keeping their employees happy.
cons: A downside is also the atmosphere of a smaller company. If you aren't the type that craves constant contact with your boss than Cintas Document  is not for you. I find it o.k. but at times it can feel like overkill.  I wonder, at times, why he's in my business... but I guess that's his job....

review_title: Great place to start a career. Can become stifling. You will love life after Cintas.
pros: Early success is achievable through hard work and results. A ten to fifteen year tenure is very possible for a new manager.
cons:
Results that achieved early success become unsustainable and crushing on work-life balance. Should be prepared to make a career change between ten and fifteen years. It will be beneficial for the individual and the company seems to want the same outcome.

Corporate office struggles with diversity initiatives at the group office level. Appear to chase quotas on gender and minorities and unfortunately have high turnover.

job_title: FS Sales Representative in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Cintas has an increadibly strong culture and set of values. They make you take test on it while you are still in training. The company as a whole is great.
cons: Can be a Con depending on the person, but all of the sales is high pressure. They want you to push the customer a lot till they either say yes or you no, in which case you just leave and don't talk to them again.

review_title: Cintas Sales --- Decent pay but a horrible job
pros: The base salary and car package are decent.  All your fuel is paid for if you get a fuel efficient car.  You will definitely learn how to sell here at Cintas, and that can help you find an enjoyable career later...but be prepared to pay the price.
cons: Nothing matters but your "numbers".  All the managers are brainwashed with Cintas culture jargon, and they don't really make any real decisions or do anything to help the sales process.  The micro-managing is out of control.  Employees are treated like grade school children.  It is an ok place to get some sales experience, but be prepared to "drink the kool-aid".  Turnover in this market has been through the roof lately!

review_title: They are an example of corporate greed
pros: Benefits aren't too bad.  I work on the Document Shredding side of Cintas (not the uniform side).
cons: This position requires a CDL class B with air brake endorsement.  However, the pay is horrible - way too low for a CDL driver.  The company makes quite a hefty profit every year, but it doesn't show in the lower levels.  Trucks always breaking down, lack of communication between the customer and the office means that when you arrive it all gets directed at you.

review_title: Cintas First Aid & Safety, going from customer to customer selling bandages and aspirin to customers who don't want any.
pros: The only pro I can think of is that you have a little freedome while on route, it's more like running your own business, except when you make a decision that your supervisor doesn't like you get disciplined.
cons: Sales goals are unrealistic. If done correctly the customer suffers from a higher bill every 3 months indefinitely. Commissions are great sometimes but if you make an extra sale your goals go up even more next month. In a way you are punished for selling more than expected because no one can always sell more and more each month to the same exact customers.

pros: Learn how to work. Do this for 2 years and leave.
cons: It's unintelligent work. They pride themselves on cold calling because they're too rigid to promote networking as you have to give away any sale made out of your territory (multi location deals are a joke). There is an antagonistic comp plan for sales and service that leads to friction instead of collaboration.

review_title: Cintastic, I don't think so! Very disappointed !
pros: Pay is good but not worth the drama that you will endure to earn it. Benifits and 401k not the best. 10 cents on the dollar for match and insurance is expensive and bare boned.
cons: Tenured partners are aggressive , assertive , and abusive. New people are treated like 3rd class citizens. They flex and abuse thier tenure to manipulate Sr. leadership to get their way. They lie and are always slithering around looking for something to get you on.

pros: Paid time off, acceptance for requesting vacation or off days are high, they sometimes provide food for events like Christmas for employees or a staff meeting, hours are set and consistent. Weekly pay.
cons: I had to quit due to supervisors just picking on you, there’s a difference between criticism and just them coming to harass you about a lot of things and then they say nonsense like I’m not doing enough, and my hourly rate was based on how much garments I hung so it was not only demanding but the supervisors made it 10x more demanding. And tiring. Definitely not considerate of employees. Also employees like to create a lot of drama together. Truly unnecessary.

review_title: Great place to get paid - not much else.
pros:
Very good compensation & benefits.  Some of the best paying sales jobs in the industry.
Great place to learn how to sell.
Management is compensated based on how well their team performs, so there is a definite incentive to make sure that individuals succeed.
The opportunity for advancement exists if you are willing to relocate and stay within the same business unit.
cons:
Very much a meat grinder with a premium placed on results above anything else, including integrity.  The expectation is to hit your number no matter what - no excuses!
Limited ability to move outside of your assigned business unit and explore alternate career paths.
Questionable eithical behavor is rewarded and tacitly encouraged.

pros: Cintas is a very strong company. This is a great place for someone who wants to venture into sales.  Successful employees are promoted and compensated well. This is a great résumé building experience.
cons: The culture is overwhelming.  Only those who give themselves and drink the kool aid will be happy.  Cintas creates a very plastic cliquey environment with an unnecessarily heavy dose of politics.  Most importantly, this is not a place for experienced sales professionals, only those without experience will thrive here.  Those with with experience selling will be asked to dismiss all quality techniques and habits that are not congruent with Cintas methods.

review_title: Best company I've ever worked for!
job_title: First Aid & Safety Service Sales Representative in Lenexa, KS
pros: Cintas is an amazing company.  I LOVE the Corporate Culture that runs through the veins of Cintas!  There is so much opportunity to advance. So many bonus money opportunities!  I've never made so much money in my whole life!
cons: Overall, there really are no cons.  There are an awful lot of little details in the pay plan that make it not so easy to understand fully.  But management there is very patient and will explain every detail until you understand.

pros:
Good base pay and potential for additional earnings

Great people to work with

Learned a lot about OSHA requirements and the safety field

You are rarely sitting in an office
cons:
Highly stressful high pressure sales environment, you basically have to be able to sell customers things they dont really need in order to hit your monthly "APEX" goals.

Interview series was not clear on expectations of the job

Extremely steep learning curve once hired on. You are more or less expected to "figure it out" most of the time.

Poor work life balance, often expected to work 6 days a week and schedulers and supervisors will NEVER turn down a training class no matter how busy you are

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Memphis, TN
pros: You meet different people and build relationships with some of them.  That’s the best part of this  job position.
cons: Employees are not appreciated.  Pay is just ok.  No career advancement.  Higher up management and local Management shows favoritism.  Location managers do not know what they’re doing.  All they think about is themselves and don’t do anything to help they’re employees.  Sales,  no matter what you do, ITS NEVER ENOUGH!!!!  Goals are unacheievable.  Do Not work for this company, not in Memphis anyway.  Do Not Look at this Company!!  If you work there GET OUT!!!  RUN FOR YOUR LIFE!!!  Do not fall for the lies!!!!  YOU WILL REGRET YOU DID!!!

review_title: Good place to work if you're in management
pros: Opportunity for growth, but only if you work hard and prove yourself. Cintas is a well-known company and has a great sales training program.
cons: If you're a great employee, your manager may try to hold you back from advancing because they don't want to lose you as an employee. Cintas is very cheap (they call it "being spartan"). They need to learn you have to spend money to make money. Each location is different. Some locations have high employee morale and others, not so much. It all depends on the management.

job_title: Territory Account Representative in Mason, OH
pros: I've been with Cintas for 4 years now and the company has been very good to me. They pay very well and the friendy atmosphere is second to none. They offer paid time off, 401K, dental, vision and health insurance. They are all about their "partners" and making sure they are healthy and happy. They go above and beyond to offer benefits to their employees to improve their overall health and wellness, including free annual blood and health screenings. They also offer partner perks such as discounts at hundreds of retailers, vehicle discount programs, travel discounts and more. Definitely a great company to work for.
cons: They expect employees to wear many many hats daily. The workload is almost always overwhelming and daunting. The unspoken expectation is that you'll be married to your job and live and breathe Cintas. In most cases the company promotes from within and strong managers help you 'climb the ladder' to success and career progression. However, there are still managers that would rather hold you back for their own personal benefit. Technology is so far behind. This makes simple daily tasks ten times harder than they should be, which in turn causes them to lack in efficiency.

pros: Good Benefits, good people to work with. 4 Day work week (That's the best part for me ! )
cons: You have to get to work at 4am to double check and get your truck ready for the day. Some days You work long hours. You have to deal with anything mother nature throws at You. Very fast pace and You need to be able to sell services and catalog sales which makes You more money (which is more of a pro than con$ ).

job_title: First Aid & Safety Service Sales Representative
pros: Freedom to manage your work load and schedule, livable wage, management tends to stay out of your hair as long as your meeting your goals.  $50 a month reimbursement for cell phone.   Benefits are decent.
cons: Company will cut your pay without thinking twice, then hits record record profits... Pay goes down over time because they move the goal post further and further every year, making it harder for you to reach goals and hit bonus--meanwhile increasing profits.  They can decide to change your route at any time to a lower volume route; this could impact your pay 10-15k a year, so don't buy a house or anything, you may not be able to afford it when Cintas decides they want  to split routes to make more money.  PTO plan was enhanced this year; however, it's still well below the average for a  fortune 100 company.  Furthermore ,they don't even let you use the time, rollover is limited to 5 days, and god forbid you get sick or need medical treatment, you are treated like a dirt bag.   I was actually directed not to seek medical treatment for a condition, because I wouldn't be able to work post surgery with a cast on.  Management is typically grown from their Management Trainee program right out of college.  So they have no real world leadership experience or common sense, thus can be brain washed by the "Corporate Culture" and are taught to master the art of peeing on people and telling them its raining.  There is literally no HR presence.  When I started I was never told what benefits I was or was not entitled, and managers either don't know, or they can't be bothered.  Come to find out, it takes 2 years to  receive any matching contributions or profit sharing in your  401K.  Something had I known, or had been clearly documented some where, I would've never taken the job.  Lastly, if you leave the company they will not cash out your PTO time, so burn it.  Moreover, even though I clearly resigned with a 2 week notice and worked the entire 2 weeks, I was marked as "Terminated".  This is laughable, reminds me of a Middle School breakup-- "I'm breaking up with you, no I'm breaking up with you first!".

pros:
4 day work week for SSR
Good healthcare options
cons: Lack of leadership. Managers only care about other managers, only care about their bonuses.  5:30 am meetings, meetings after work if you do not hit certain goals. Low base pay and capped commissions. You are required to sale and get renewals, while dealing with customer complaints and servicing the accounts. Very dirty work, picking up dirty floor mats, dirty towels, dirty uniforms, dirty mops, and so on. Cintas is extremely over priced and they do price increase customers every year. Very unfair to the customer when their bill goes up 30-40% a year. Customers have to sign long 60 month contracts. At the end of a contract, if a customer does not send in a letter wanting to quit Cintas they will get auto renewed for the term of their original contract. If you are not a manager at Cintas, you are just another number. They do not care about you. Do not work for this company.

pros: I was fortunate to take company vehicle home due to remote route 80 miles away, one way.
cons: High demand in performance for little recognition. The general manager was a fantastic manager. The service managers; not so much. Lack of communication with SSRs & at times, highly unrealistic goals. I signed up for a 7am-4pm job and got a 7am-7pm, 5 days a week job. Also, lack of help when needed from Service Managers (your direct supervisor). Job is also not just servicing your route customers but heavy focus on sales as well as bad debt collecting.

pros: Worked with a great team. Invest in good training for sales team.
cons: They pride themselves on being a debt free company even if it’s at their employees expense. When the covid 19 effected the business of course they have to make sense out of having a full sales staff. But to “let you go” at 1:30 in the afternoon completely blindsided then have them cut off both mine and my newborns health insurance along with my car insurance at midnight that night. Horrible to treat your employees like that. They didn’t give us any time to get our affairs in order and I no longer have any loyalty or respect for the company.

job_title: SSR Uniform Route in Rockford, IL
pros: Cintas has good benefits and reasonable pay for the work performed.  Information about new products and services are shared in bi-weekly meetings.  A good job for a younger person looking to start a career.  The company is well run and operates on solid ideals.
cons: Although the vacation time is good, vacation election is based on seniority and the newer people are often left with less than desirable options.  There are several paid holidays but the weeks around the holidays are normally blacked out so they can't be taken off.  Trainings are often boring and unimaginative.  Pay is partial commission so any negative billings affect your pay; this is especially frustrating when dealing with national accounts who pay less than the average customer to begin with.

review_title: Cintas was a good place to work at.
pros:
Lots of camaraderie among peers 
Good pay. Stock options as well. 
Flexible with schedule. However the manager makes or breaks this company.
cons: Can be demanding. Lots of control with sales activity. They seem to be more worried about getting your daily number of visits down than the actual sales you make.

pros: Cintas offers all partners the opportunity to advance in the company.   Cintas offers training in virtually every area of the business through online programs and seminars.  Management at this company has an open door policy and respects the ideas of their partners.  Cintas offers great benefits and fronts the cost for the majority of these.   Work hard with this company and good things will come to you.
cons: Management can sometimes be slow to move on important iniatives.   Goals are often very lofty and can sometimes be seen as unachievable.  The 401K match is subpar to other companies of this size and bonuses are very hard to reach.

pros: Get free umbrella for working at Cintas this year!  Everyone looks nice cause we have to wear suits and ties / dresses.
cons:
Poor benefits
Have to pay for lunch when you travel.
Everyone has to work at least till 5 and do not encourage telecommuting.
Penny pinching risk averse culture at the expense of growth - if you want to grow as a person or as a potential 401K, do not work here!

review_title: started out undertrained but learned my way.
pros: Decent pay and opportunity to learn.  Opportunity to step up and lead others in a positive and meaningful way.  Comradery and relationship building easy to obtain with a good group.
cons: sometimes under staffed, micro managed and way to many little things to do that should be left to plant workers and office staff.  Leave the selling and service to us.  Constant shortfalls coming from plant support workers,  Lack of product and product quality.  Shoddy pay for plant workers means shoddy work.  Service and sometimes ethics are sacraficed to reach ever increasing numbers.

review_title: Culture shock, Cintas is a world of its own.
pros: Corporate is concerned with the overall contentment and safety of all employee's(Partners). "Corporate" Not location.
cons: To many "idea people" Nobody to speak of with the “I will do attitude". Everybody is eager to delegate but nobody want the responsibility of doing it themselves. WAY TO MUCH "brown nosing"!!   Absolutely no support structure, it is clearly sink or swim. I have had to re-event the wheel in many different facets within my department simply because trainers and management in my option by there lack of actions frankly could care less if you’re successful. If your going to be succesful here you must do so ON YOUR OWN!

review_title: Good for most, Great for some
pros: potential quick promotional track for talented and skilled management personnel, great company culture and infrastructure, great people, good multi business function exposure & opportunities, best overall in its industry and growing.  Typically low turnover
cons: truth is, if you have skills and determination, there really aren't much in 'cons'.  Some salaries can be just average, and raises can be a bit spartan, but some are still good for the market and the talent they are given to.  I have seen great opportunities granted to more than usual, but also great talent overlooked for due opportunities, or well earned raises put off on a few occasions

pros: Interviews today pretty laid back that's really all I can say I need a 20 word minium so I'm just kind of writing. Great
cons: They string you along on a series of interviews (5) where they ask you a bunch of questions and tend to not believe you on anything that you already answered at the end of this 5 process interview you'll probably won't be qualified enough to walk into businesses and try to sell floor mats are cleaning regardless of your years of sales experience services but you will be qualified enough to hop on a truck at 3 in the morning and pick up dirty floor mats and uniforms and drop off clean ones to companies with the hope that you might be able to move up in the company in 6 months but I'm sure that's what the tell all the girls

pros: Cintas has a good benefits package and stock. To work alone without anyone down your neck all day. Pay is ok, but not the greatest for what they expect .
cons: You will learn to love working long days and dealing with customers who's prices have increased without notice. I have noticed that managment is kinda like "whatever" whenever something comes up, that they dont feel like dealing with.

job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Tampa, FL
pros: Four day work week. Fellow partners. Decent benefits. Good job for a single individual.  If you run a clean and efficient route you'll have amazing customers.
cons: Worked at two locations in 9 years.  My first experience was by far the best I ever had. Second location did not live up to my expectations I had for Cintas. Ethics and decisions of management made me look to different opportunities. Did not agree of how management ran our operations in Florida. Not too toot my own horn but I believe Cintas lost a very valuable employee. Thank you 780 for my experience and memories.

job_title: Service Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
Good benefits
Good pay for front-line partners (but not for supervisor/department manager level)
Good place to start, but probably not continue, a career
cons:
Brutal hours (days that start with texts at 4:30am and end at 11pm).  Expect to work 60 hours per week in this position.
Lack of clarity on goals and focuses
Almost no work-life balance
Promotions and growth are all about who you know and who you will pander to

review_title: Strong company politics, Weak opportunity for individual growth...
pros:
- Solid company based on foundation and morals
- Effective hierarchy of positions
- Decent Pay
cons:
- No structure at inception of new division
- Employees are stuck on old ways leaving out any chance of innovation or ideas 
- Many company policies are irrational and unrelated to anything important 
- Training is ineffective to potential employees coming from sales backgrounds which allow more freedom and "outside-of-the-box" mentality.

pros:
- They care about your success (if you arent doing well, they will sit down and talk to you to see if theres anything they can help with, if you need anything, or have any questions)
- Very off hands environment (only was in office a couple hours every week. The rest of the week we are out prospecting & meeting with people)
- They give you everything you need to succeed (supplies, equipment, training, etc)
- you can sell services to any business and business industry
cons:
- they expect you to sell something every week (which isn't too hard but some weeks you're working long hours but still no sales made for that week)
- you must be there lfor about a year to fully understand how everything works, inside and outside

job_title: Sales Associate in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: They are a very stable company that has experienced growth in each fiscal year since they opened in 1968. They are a very hard working company that really does think about their employees while making decisions. The benefits they offer are second to none. They work well around home schedules. I have had to take 4 days off when my wife and I had our baby and they were fantastic about that.
cons: I was initially told the pay salary was 40,000 and then when it was time to sign the employee aggreements, it suddenly became 38,000. The sales system is a little bit too micro managed.

pros:
Safety training monthly.
Large networking opportunity.
Immersion into a strict corporate culture.
Opportunity to continue with the company after graduation.
cons:
Poor communication between the management and the employees.
Poor communication between the different departments.
A willingness for sales managers to use sales employees as a stepping stone.
Lack of quality constructive criticism.

pros: Good Benefits, fair pay, stable company, opportunity to move withing the company, promotions, good bonus potential. They do a lot for their front line partners...ie cookouts, prizes, gifts, ect.
cons: Long hours have to be worked when in management. The uniform business is very competitive always fighting to keep customers happy and with Cintas. Cintas prices themselves out of many markets. Price increases on customers constantly!

job_title: Service Manager in Port Washington, NY
pros: They don't work nights or weekend, which is good.  The benefits are okay but you have to pay a substantial portion of your paycheck into them each week.  I took a pay cut to move to another career field yet I net more money each week.
cons: The Port Washington, NY Branch is a joke.  I was a Service Manager at that location and it was the worst experience of my life (worse than two deployments to Iraq).  Most of the employees are stupid and/or lazy so a handful of people try to get everything done, which is impossible.  The pay to work ratio is drastically out of portion and the whole location is set up for failure.  Management acts like they care about the employees but they only care about the almighty dollar.  STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!

job_title: Service Supervisor in Spring Hill, TN
pros: Great benefits, good community oriented corporation.  Started well, treated well, and plenty of training available throughout the duration of my time here.
cons: Horrible GM and awful service managers.  Too much here was all about perception and meetings, doing things that serve no purpose just to do them.  Not military friendly, pretty cut throat, and people bringing in $ (sales), could violate every policy as long as the $ keeps coming in.  If you're short people, you are forced to do other people's work then get in trouble when yours doesn't get done.

pros: 4 day work week, meaning 52 extra days off! Days can be long if you're not organized and don't plan your days.
cons: Vacation time and sick days are terrible. You will have to wait one year to get one week off (4 days) and 2 years for 2 weeks (8 days), the third week comes after your 7th anniversary and the 4th after your 15th. Vacations don't roll over, use them or lose them. Most companies pay out your unused sick days as an incentive, Cintas does not.

review_title: If looking for a job keep on looking
pros: Great training, descent salary If you like hard work you will find it here. You will be in the best shape of your life.
cons: way too long hours, push employees for unachievable goals, middle management is pushed for results at any cost. When you hit the 15 or so year mark you are forced out. It has happened to 5 teammates that I know of personally from our location. mandatory price increases. They would set the whole location in a room, give us an amount, and we would have to go through each invoice and do price increases until the number is achieved.

job_title: Service Sales Representative (IV Day SSR) in Houston, TX
pros:
Good co workers, helpful and fun
Tools to be successful is available
4 Days work week
cons:
The Managers suck! Worst managers any company will ever have or ask for. My location was terrible
LACK OF COMMUNICATION. Things change up on you like an accident, and they will expect you to know already.
Managers/Supervisors are not proactive to help the Service Reps, only when a customer calls and complain.
Pay SUCKS! Unless you stay on your sales
TRUCK has no AC or Heater. Be ready for hell!!

review_title: Could be great....and maybe it is for some
pros:
4 day work week
Great benefits
Great coworkers
Decent lower level management
Getting to know customers was great
cons:
Hard to hit some target KPI’s that greatly effect your pay. They like to dangle the money in your face then make it hard to attain.
Sometimes trucks aren’t loaded correctly.
Most of the time they are out of product needed for the customers. 
Upper management are not very hands on and the GM seems to only care about the numbers. 
Low team morale because of the emphasis on KPIs to get paid what you are worth.
some trucks don’t have AC and some barely have heat.

pros: Money is great.  All I have to do is find ways to take it from my customers pockets and put it into Cintas's (mine)
cons: Tough on your mind if you have any morals / ethics.  The idea of ripping off churches and small family run businesses because they typically have poor accounting / oversight of their books.  Made it tough to sleep at first, trained to think that if they dont take the time to think about what they are paying, then its too bad for them.

review_title: Do not work for this location
pros: Very good health insurance; in fact best I have ever had.  Day after Thanksgiving was considered a holiday, so that was very nice
cons: Upper Management micro managed too much; nothing was ever done fast or well enough.  Management created a very chaotic/hostile work environment.  If you allow, your spirit and confidence will be destroyed.  Was lied to several times.  During my tenure five people left from the office, and no one was ever replaced; duties were disbursed among the remaining Partners, which was very stressful.  The threat of job loss was daily.  The worst two years of my career.  I have never felt as unappreciated and disposable as I did at Cintas.

review_title: Cintas is a great company that provides a quality service and listens to their customers.
pros:
Cintas Partners are wonderful people! They all understand that the service aspect is the heart of the business and strive to develop and support one another. 
Cintas' values and mission are future focused and goal oriented. Weekly coaching is given and the freedom to run your "own business" is provided.
cons:
Communication between management and other partners can become clouded due to profitability goals or requirements. 
Office Partners are often required to complete multiple roles due to the hopes of saving money.

pros: I have none it is the worse place to work
cons: Managers and supervisors treat you like your just a nobody! It's like being in a preschool not allowed to talk or use bathroom when you need too. No  promotions within the company they will not promote even if you been with company for decades . Really bad wage increases if your lucky you get 5 cents a year. Very short breaks so short that supervisors with a buzzer just like preschool when recess is over! They hate training people especially if your NEW...so good luck. Also don't be smart and don't have a voice or you will get fired. It's a company secret when they fire you it will be a unexpected surprise with false info to corporate. Beware everything in this company is a secret!!!!! Don't talk or you will get mistreated

review_title: If you weren't in the military and want a sales career and friends for life, work at Cintas
pros: Outstanding training, team events, cultural immersion in to Fortune 500 behaviors and best practices.  The do's and don't here will set you up for success anywhere.
cons: Super strict, however, so is the Navy SEALS.  Do you want to be the best?  I think there are cons here but looking back if I can't remember them they weren't serious.

pros: Great culture, good people, attainable sales quotas, training programs set up to get you going quickly and knowledgable.  Safety is first and foremost, closely followed by the bottom line.
cons: Things my manager told me in the interview were not necessarily true.  Their average SSR do not make near 50k/year.  They reroute you way too much, as I lost my most lucrative territory and forcing me to take a pay cut in the process.  The 'bridge' pay is only 13 weeks long and drops lower every week, forcing me to grow my route back again before I even see all of my customers for the first time.  Don't mess with your employees paychecks!

job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Springdale, AR
pros: Only worked 4 days a week. Start the day at 5am and be done by 3-4pm depending on the location one  would go to. Got paid weekly, off holidays and black friday, good benenifits and employee owned stock. Get to drive and no one  is on you watching what you do.
cons: Don't get to use the vacation time when needed had to put it in at least 2 months in advance. Alot of body pain its heavy work especially when it rains on your lower back and knees.

pros: Great people and culture.  Opportunities are plentiful. Compensation and benefits are excellent. You can spend an entire career with one company . Leadership cares and makes efforts to maintain a good working environment. Very safety conscious company.
cons: Cintas is not for everyone.  If you don't want to work as a team or care about the performance of the company you work for---don't waste your time. Lazy people or those with bad attitudes will be weeded out.

job_title: Fire Alarm Technician in Tucson, AZ
pros: Cintas has a amazing company culture. Very close knit with partners (employees) and their families. I work here for one year as I got myself through school and I loved the culture and competitive pay scale. Cintas believes in paying their partners well and that is is something you never see in Tucson, AZ. Very good benefits to go along with a great company. There's room for growth if you work hard.
cons:
Growth comes only if you're a perfect employee. Must outshine everyone else.
Management can be slave drivers at times. If they have numbers they want to meet, you'll probably be working 12+ hours days.

job_title: First Aid & Safety Service Sales Representative in Mayflower, AR
pros: Cintas does pay well once you have been in your territory after 6 months or so. I made well over $100k my first year and looking at $125k my second. However, my success was based off me working myself around 55 to 60 hours a week with a only 1 vacation in two years. The product offering is really strong in the First Aid services and number of suppliers they can pull from. My service team and co workers were great people. The director and VP of the First Aid division were incredible as well. This job is a stepping stone for much better opportunities.
cons: The culture at Cintas was very robotic. It was very odd especially for the industry and customer base. We were forced to wear a suit and tie for everything. Wearing clothes like that at lumber mills and manufacturing facilities was just weird. I would dress the “right” way for the office days and then change clothes before facing customers. We couldn’t have beards which wasn’t told to me until after I had been there a few weeks. The benefits were really terrible and designed to make you feel stuck. 401K program was a joke and I was lied to about it. I was told is was a 20% match which is unheard of it. I question it but was told that’s correct. Completely false. It’s 20% of the total you put in. So you have to put in 10% and they match 20% of your 10%. There’s no match for over 1 1/2 and then it’s pennies compared to basically any other major company.  The vesting period is 5 years so the match doesn’t matter anything. The on boarding is the worse I’ve ever experienced in 15 years of sales and management. You don’t even go to “training/RBS” until after 6 months or so. Cintas doesn’t even invest in their people until they have already passed the trial by fire due to very high turnover of salespeople.

job_title: Accounts Receivable Specialist in Toronto, ON
pros:
Monday to Friday 8 to 4:30
Weekly pay
cons:
A lot of pressure from upper management
The company recently switch over to SAP system and no one knows how to use the system even the trainers
Management runs the company to the point they can do whatever they please but if you are a regular employee without a title you are treated like garbage
No sense of job security, feel as if one mistake is done they look for reasons to fire you
The turnover for positions other than management is horrendous, such a long process to get hired but a simple snap of the GMs finger and that person is out of here

pros: Great health benefits. My schedule was good. Previous management was very helpful and understanding. Training with previous management was great.  Everyone knew how to train and was very willing to assist
cons: Very poor management.  Moral was very low at my location.  Unsanitary working conditions (ie. breakroom and bathrooms). No leadership.  The pay was terrible for the work they asked their "partners" to do.

review_title: Lots of good, lots of bad
pros: Great compensation, lots of potential for advancement, promotes from within in most cases
cons: overworks the employees to no end, expects long long hours, limited support from management, acts like a typical old-school big corporation in how it treats their employees (anti-union, does not value seniority and experience, micromanages to the nth degree)

review_title: Very demanding and ever changing company. Not always for the better.
pros: Good insurance, quarterly bonus, 4 day work week, flexible hours
cons: Demanding, expected to sell $500 of cheaply made product a week while maintaining your weekly rental volume. Management does not help out unless something has already gone wrong with a customer. Excuses are required with this business. Constant shortages

pros: So many opportunities for driven individuals.  The sky is literally the limit as long as you have the vision.  Access to high level executives from the beginning and invested interest in your career. Company is growing extremely fast so constant need for future leaders.
cons: Tenured partners can get in your head about opportunities because of how long it took them to get to their level.  The pay is competitive at the start but can seem a bit low for the amount of hours you put in.  It pays off in the long run though.

job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Mason, OH
pros: A good training ground for people straight out of college. They will introduce you to a lot of different business situations that help sharpen your skills for your next job.
cons: Cintas is a company that is working to improve shareholder value but forgets about their employees quite frequently. CIntas has a culture of overworked and underpaid employees. They call all of their employees partners but in reality you feel more like a number. I worked at a branch level as well as at the corporate level.

review_title: Being Spartan sometimes equals being cheap
pros:
- Friendly people to work with
- Depending on what department you worked in there were some great managers
- Good Overall Benefits
cons:
- penalized on review if you took sick days (sick and PTO were separate)
- Depending on what department you worked in there were some great managers
- One of main tenets of being Spartan, which essentially means spend your money wisely, could turn quickly into being cheap. Many company events either didn't happen or were put together very last minute with tiny budgets that the event was almost more an insult to the partners than a celebration.

review_title: Not as Great as You May Think!
pros:
Benefits
PTO
Cafeteria 
Status of working for Cintas
Salary
cons:
The work environment is completely dated and they treat the Global Supply Chain poorly.
Upper management is too concerned with playing it safe and not speaking up about partner issues.
HR doesn’t know how to do their job or properly assist you with issues you may have.
There is no structured training, so expect to not receive any proper training.
Co-workers (especially older ones) are too caught up on drama and other people’s business, especially newer associates.
Business professional dress code is terrible for a dated building that is mostly a distribution center.
Location—this is not located downtown Chicago, it is located 45 mins south of city.
Bonuses are typically 2-3% increases (lol)

review_title: Great fringe benefits but salary stinks!
pros: Flexibility and endless opportunity to earn commission.  The car package is great too.  Free car, free gas, free insurance.  The flexibility ensures a healthy work/life balance.  Recognition is a plus for Cintas.  They post results daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly so you know where you stand vs. your peers.
cons: Salary is very low compared to other sales organizations.  Another downside to Cintas is that there is very little room to grow if you are not a white male.  Our organizations leaders above my role are all white males.  This is discouraging. There is also no focus on growing an individuals strengths or improving their weaknesses.

review_title: One of the 50 best companies to sell for according to Selling Power magazine.
pros: For the most part a good environment.  For new people entering their first or second sales job the attention from sales management is good.  If you are a peak performer your opportunities for advancement to the sales manager level are fantastic.
cons: Micromanagement has crept into the weekly activities of the Cintas Sales Professional.  Sales training is kept at a 101 level.

job_title: Management Trainee, Plant Manager, Service Manager, in Denver, CO
pros: If you don't like your wife or children, enjoy doing more for less $$$, lying to customers that you have developed friendships with, raising prices for long term loyal customers to help offset low prices offered to new customers this is would be a perfect fit.
cons: Do you enjoy folding shop towels or running a route when you a middle level manager?  Yep, have at it!!!

job_title: Outside Sales Representative in Nashville, TN
pros:
- Great camaraderie on the sales team
- Compensation plan is fair (as long as you have a strong territory)
- Good benefits package/ car package
- Great sales training program
cons:
- Difficult to hit weekly sales expectations if you have a territory with few prospects
- Little to no sales leads for rural/small territory 
- Hard to sell on value when people can create these facility programs themselves for less money
- Very conservative, don't like "out-of-the-box" ideas
- Have to enter every little activity in the CRM

review_title: be careful what you ask for
pros: Benefits and pay is competitive
cons: You may need to check your ethics at the door.  Cintas makes money, lets be clear about that.  Upper management says to do things the right way.  Middle management pretends to want to do things the right way.  They don't want the crap to roll downhill on them, so they push the crap down on the Service Sales Reps.  I was fired for not exceeding the sales quotas of an SSR who was fired for unethical sales-HUH?

job_title: Commercial Sales Representative in Tustin, CA
pros:
Good opportunity if you're blessed with a strong territory - if you're lucky enough, you can inherit a very large enterprise account and not have to cold-call
Well-recognized company that can help you build your resume
cons:
Outdated and heavily scripted sales methodology
Boundaries of territories are arbitrary and have very uneven potential
Culture driven by process which is held above the humanity of its workforce
It was never shared during my interview process, but once a quarter you are required to "ride-along" with service drivers and assist carrying heavy loads at risk of great injury.

review_title: Good company depending on what division you're in
pros: Extremely stable, never have to worry about layoffs, good economic performance.  Good training programs for all roles.  There is a huge variance in leadership based on the location you're at, so I could go either way with that being a positive or a negative!
cons: Complete lack of work/life balance, very high expectations and limited opportunities if you're not at the corporate office.  Sometimes it feels like the things we say make us better/different than our competitors are not true and that we are just the same.

review_title: First aid and safety sales Rep
job_title: First Aid and Safety Sales Representative
pros: Lots of great products, strong leadership, fair compensation, great benefits, great people to work with. Finally updating technology with CRM and new tablets. Always adding new and innovative products to sell. Great car package. Plenty of opportunity to move up if you produce and are relocatable.
cons: Numbers are really aggressive to qualify for a bonus, very structured, (which isn't that bad) they focus too much on the month instead of quarter.

pros:
Great place to build your customer service skills . Good benefits,profit sharing,401k..

This is a great company to gain experience , but most positions there are just not compatible with my talents and skills.
cons: Constant shortages ,inconsistent  quality of product , adding more responsibilities without proper compensation .Job is way too physical and definitely for younger people not worried about beating their bodies up . Management is inconsistent , some are helpful , some are difficult and frustrating . They need to communicate more with each other and get on the same page. They are great with numbers , but lack in leadership.

job_title: Uniform Room Manager in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Cintas is a large company with international opportunities, good benefits, 401k, clothing discounts,  and ample room for advancement across many career choices.
cons: Cintas is a rather conservative company, with a strict dress code, and expectations that you will do whatever is needed to advance with in the company, including relocate, travel , or change your career path.

review_title: Poor Executive Leadership, Out of touch with reality
job_title: Advanced Management Candidate in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
So overworked you have job security 
Safety culture is good, no weekends, major holidays off, 401k, good benefits, there are advancement opportunities
cons:
Poor work life balance
Too many initiatives occurring simultaneously 
Executives are part of the “good old boys” club
No diversity: no gay people, no tattoos, no colorful hair
Not a positive work environment for creative millennials
Pay NOT equal for women
Initiatives area not rolled out effectively ever
Regional Directors are not in the field so they have no idea what is occurring
Long hours 10 to 12 plus for Managers

review_title: Working at Cintas can be challenging, but very rewarding financially.
pros: Compensation and upward mobility are two components that make Cintas a great company to work for in this day and age.
cons: Very long hiring process for sales roles that sometimes require extensive travel to meet with leadership. This can be daunting, but it's so worth it if you can actually get hired. Cintas sales reps earn very handsome wages.

job_title: Service Supervisor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Chance for growth, and able to work in a high paced environment where you will come across some great resume builder opportunities
cons: They will overwork you if you are salary. When I say overwork, I dont mean 50 hours, that is easy. I mean 65-80 hours. Becuase there is a big pressure to hit the numbers, alot of stuff can happen that is unethical. It can be anything from working overnight in bad conditions to working while sick or hurt. there is a lot of great potential for this company, but they are a company set working in the 90's corporate blue collar work.

pros: Great training program. I loved that there was a process to follow and they gave me the tools to continue using them in the field. Although the role play wasn't always fun, it helped me to practice my presentation skills and overcoming objections from decision makers in the field.
cons: My particular manager was micro-managing. Expectations were not clear. I never felt good enough even though I was doing an outstanding job at my level of tenure.

review_title: Cintas is a good place to work.
pros:
A moajority of Cintas employees at the corp office have more than 10-15 years with the company.  You don't often see a majority of employees with a ten-year that high.  The corprate culture places family values higher than professional requirements.

Cintas is also growing and approaching a new level of expansion into Europe and Asia.  The company has the personal culture of a smaller company, but the size and benefits of a 4+ Billion dollar company.
cons: There is normally a corporate policy on everything, including eating at your desk.  Although this helps make the rules very clear, it is sometimes overkill.

pros: Medical benefits are good.You don not have to worry about the company going belly up because their financials are in very good shape.
cons: The Hours! Job description says 40 hours per week, but in reality you work 50-60 hours a week with no bump in pay. You are on salary, but if you need a day off it comes from your sick leave time or vacation time.Family life? What is that!

review_title: Great company to work for with a lot of opportunities for growth.
pros: A lot of opportunity of growth within the company. Excellent benefits and vacation time.
cons: Much hard work is overlooked if numbers are not met. The end result is all that really matters to most managers. Credit is rarely given for anything that is over the top! Work days are often a lot longer than promised and you're not getting paid when "they"(management) are wasting your time to be doing business.

job_title: Route Driver Sales Representative in Phenix City, AL
pros: different place every day, nice people to work with a lot of time off work was spent with coworkers and they made it a family, flexible hours
cons: I liked this job didn't want to leave but after being there 9 mouths had a Dr. appointment this is when I find out I was paying for insurance but wasn't ??? they (Cintas) said I had it. it was bring taken out of my pay but came time to use it didn't have it, wasn't being paid for overtime nor weekends some times 20 hour day, not to mention hourly rate was to be $14 an hour more like $12.34  later they had some big lawsuit against them

pros: Great sales training both at start and ongoing. Very Structured which is good at the beginning as it gets you moving in the right direction. Comp plan can be very good depending on what your standard is and how hard you are going to work for it. With it being a very large company there are many different ways that you can be promoted. Culture is good and have great people that work there at all levels.
cons: Depending on the leadership in place it can be very micromanaging environment. For those who are more tenured this may not be an ideal environment for you. You are expected to grind grind and grind on acitivty (which is sales) and on top of that have meetings to fit it which makes work life balance tricky with 5am service meetings that are mandatory or 5pm back to the office calls on fridays. The route rides are pointless at most times and take people out of the field and their homes for insane hours. You can move within the organization but you have to have a Presidents club behind you in order to be considered "qualified" to be promoted which clearly kicks out people who may actually be great future leaders. This is especially demotivating for those who surpass that number but missed certain measures that technically disqualify them. Pay is good, good base salary but every year they are consistently changing the comp plans with majority of the time its to cut the comp down and make less. There is an atmosphere of "they dont want us to make too much money" that whispers around the sales teams when all the selling rules are changed. Comp plan roll outs need to be done and communicated better.

pros:
-Good pay for an entry level position.
-Opportunity to move up if successful
-Partners and Management are friendly and always willing to help
-Great training programs
-benefits healthcare and 401K contributions are really great for a entry level position
cons:
-This is a sales job, it's listed as a service sales rep, but make no mistake about it this is a sales job with very real quotas that must be met or you will be fired. This isn't a bad thing. but people need to realize that you are not a delivery driver, except that you are a delivery driver who is expected to sell and grow your territory

-the Territory you get starting out is luck based and depends on when you're hired, if they are adding new route because of growth, expect a much smaller route which means less money.  If they hire you to replace someone there's a good chance the route you will be covering is established and a good chance to make some good money. Regardless of your skills as a sales person you can start the job making 60k+ based on nothing more than residual sales, you can also start the job at 35k because your territory is small and they expect you to grow it, again this has nothing to do with your talent level when you initially start out and more to do with the luck of the draw that was handed to you. My first route had me making around 45K annually, they guy they hired literally 1 month after i was hired took over a power route and was making 60k, we both hit our growth numbers at around the same clip respectfully yet he made 15k more than I did.

-it Is very demanding and if you have a route that is far away, you will almost certainly be working 60 hours a week.

-this may be more manager dependent but if you are falling behind on your numbers, you will be micro managed. happened to me at one point and several other partners. they try their best to be helpful and they are at least engaging on the matter, but you will be micro managed until your numbers come back to form.

pros:
Peers. Everyone stepped in to share the pain.
Mon-Friday, weekends off.
Medical/Dental Benefits
cons: Everything else. As a Supervisor at this location you will have the opportunity to supervise NOTHING. You will be "running route" meaning doing the drivers' job, then come back and do your job. You will be expected to work 12-15hrs a day, Monday thru Friday. You will NOT be compensated beyond your 50k salary for the extra time. The turnover rate is insane and they are terribly understaffed. For everyone they hire, another one leaves, so they're not really making headway. If you have any other option.....go somewhere else.

If you come to work and do your best everyday, making this company richer, it's looked at as what you ought to do. 3% raises every year just didn't cut it for me. Inflation rises at about 3.5%.
