Upset customers because of hidden charges . "make-up" charges. drivers are allowed to give credit to customers but don't make it back to "AR" until we are calling for collections.  There is alot of back peddling with this company.  T

pros: The company provides a great career development program and training!  Opportunities for advancement exist if you're willing to work hard.  what more can you ask for?
cons: I worked an average of 70 hours/week.  Annual budget process resulted in goals that were extremely difficult to attain.

pros: If you are looking to secure a mediocre salary and stay in the same position working with incompetent people for 25 years, then go here. I would NEVER recommend this to a new grad or anyone interested in working among other intelligent, talented people. This is a place for 30-somethings who don't have a degree and are just looking for a solid job to get by. Since everyone is lazy and incompetent, you can get away with (or even praised) for doing very, very little.
cons: The company is your typical American, bureaucratic landfill. Full of people who have been working the same position for 25 years and are happy and perfectly content. I was there for 6 months and felt like my brain was rotting.

pros: 4 day work week. Good benefits. Sales would pay cash for leads. If you get, or build, a good route you are set.
cons: Worst company have ever been associated. Upper management is a joke. Unless you work at a cleaning facility you will be short on product constantly and expected to still charge customer for missing product. Want unattainable numbers unless you either manipulate the computer system or cheat client. I worked there over 4 years and consistently grew my route exceeding sales goals from catalog and new business and still wasn't able to meet bonus because I would not charge customer for something they didn't receive. Sales division would be the route to go with this company. Maximum benefits with minimal effort.

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Rockford, IL
pros: Great place to work with awesome partners that are all stiving to achieve the same goals. Great managment team that always will continue to grow with you and care about how you are doing on the job.
cons: The only cons for this position would be the time you have to work. If you are not a morning person this job is not for you!

pros: You are able to start early and leave early, as long as you work 8 hours
cons: There are more cons than I can say. The company takes advantage of their employees, the pay is awful, the expectations continue to become not realistic. The prices are extremely high so many customers drop the program which creates the employee to lose money. There are point less meetings that waste time. The company provides you with paid time off, however it is difficult to use them without it affecting your pay and KPIS that must be hit monthly.  Do not waste your time working for this company, you will be disappointed, stressed and very unhappy

pros: Weekly paycheck and that’s about it!
cons: No support from management, extremely corporate to the point of being uncomfortable. They actually have no idea how miserable the environment is and how behind on the times they truly are. The corporate hq has some people who understand but they are not the ones who have the ability to drive change.  Once you are in the door you will realize you are just another number. I believe full heartedly that this company does not care about its employees.

pros: Lots of opportunities, pay is competitive if not above when combined with the job stability and benefits.  Great family atmosphere.
cons: lonh hours, sometimes the corporate office seems to have lost touch with the field offices.  Too many people at corporate have the ability to demand time and action out of the field people without having direct management over them.

job_title: Management Trainee in Fort Myers, FL
pros:
Ok Benefits
Decent Salary
Experience 
Oppurtunity for Advancement
cons:
Poor work/life balance
Long Hours (hrs were 5am to 6:30pm)
Severly Under Staffed
Most of my time was in warehouse doing meticlious work or covering a SSR's route with no route book. 
High Stress

pros: Starts out fine. Good pay, benefits, etc.
cons: Once you get in, you realize how crooked this company is (especially in how it deals with its customers). EVERY YEAR the pay structure changes. I am sick of being screwed every year. Expectations go up, pay goes down. It really is a miserable place to work. I'm out of here first chance I get.

pros: Professional culture, performance-based, Understands the critical importance of meticulous hiring and development of personnel (i.e., succession planning). Good opportunities for growth. Solid management training programs.
cons: Can be bureaucratic, depending on where and for whom you work. Some managers are not leaders or developers of people, even though, generally, these characteristics are highly valued by the corporation.

review_title: Good to start with, tough to stay with!
job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Monroe Township, NJ
pros: Great training, nice car package, rapid promotion if your in the right crowd. Very rewarding when you hit your numbers. Great leaping pad to bigger and better career moves.
cons: Only way for rapid promotion is to be in the right crowd. Lots of looking out for friends instead of the best person.

pros: Benefits are great, opportunity for advancement, multiple locations to relocate, guaranteed full time hours, steady work, co-workers are great.
cons: Politics, management isn't great, not the same Cintas at each location, everything depends on who the GM is and what division you're in. Then it trickles down from there.

review_title: Amazing place to work where partners want you to succeed!
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Career development! Set a goal and someone will help you get there! Great benefits! Great partners!  Stable company with lots of room for growth. A lot of internal training opportunities are provided.
cons: PTO time could be a little more. Also, some salaries seem lower than other places.  But a lot of people leave for those things, yet come back because the pros at Cintas make up for the cons.

review_title: Good benefits, terrible work life balance.
job_title: Service Sales Representative in Medford, OR
pros:
Autonomy and freedom to run “your” business. 
Good training for new hires. 
Expectations are generally clearly outlined. 
Success offers opportunity for advancement.
cons:
No support from management. 
Make your goals or be ready to be let go. 
Not much concern for the individual.

review_title: 4.5 out of 5 Stars about says it all
pros: The people are generally a cut above the average and there is great support and corporate culture for those who fit the bill (and many do not want to) but the incentives are there for those who work (I doubled my income the day Cintas took over our old company).
cons: not everyone fits the bill & not everyone wants to enough to enjoy the perks of being #1.

pros: You can earn a great amount of money and get to work in an outside sales position. Lots of freedom as long as you are producing numbers.
cons: Not a lot of potential for forward advancement. The position is a grind. A focus on new business and on to the next client. If you are a hunter this is for you.

pros: Lots of great training, great and supportive culture, great pay out of college, excellent benefits, autonomy and some flexibility.
cons: Depending on your location will dictate you success and support, early hours sometimes, and lots of physical labor, working with dirty clothes. This job is not for everyone. If you want to move up to corporate work quickly in your career, this a great way to do it. Work life balance depends on your location.

pros: Great perks and bonuses. Can make your own hours a In regards to how long you desire to work. Always pushing for improvement and looking to promote from within. Great company to grow in.
cons: Communication amongst management and customers can be difficult. Cintas expects high performs with a sense of urgency for all customers, every single day. Sometimes you may not be Easilt accessible to a customer, however Cintas expects those things to be handled while still doing your daily duties. The job can be physically exhausting and takes a toll on your body

pros:
- Pay is well structured and based off the success of your business 
 - Opportunities to move up the ladder
 - Benefits 
 - Weekends off
cons:
- Lax enforcement of policy
 - Little attention given to training and infrastructure 
 - Difficult to remove problem employees 
 - High turn over in plant positions

job_title: Service Sales Representative in San Antonio, TX
pros: You make your own schedule, meet great people while out on route
cons: Horrible management, constantly push reps to sell things a customer doesn’t need. Manager rolls out the red carpet when you’re hired so you think you have a great manager. Eventually you see they really aren’t great. HR mingles in the same office as managers so they’re “friends”. There’s no discretion, they have no problem throwing your name around if you voice a concern. Cintas says they are “essential” during COVID19, all they focus on is money. If you fear for your health they don’t care. It’s the job you signed up for.

review_title: Nasty! Cheap! Strict! No Respect! They work you to death! Run away!!  Do not apply!!!
pros: Close to home for me
cons: A very cheap compay.  Horrible worklife balance unless you don't have a life outside work.  No respect.  Very strict.  No joy.  Very dull.  They discourage socialization and force you to eat in their cafeteria in order of your position in the corporate hierarchy.  Spirit we share is shoved down your throat.

review_title: My experience has been very mixed.
job_title: IT Business Analyst in Cincinnati, OH
pros: There is always a constant flow of work. Everyday seems to be much different than the nprior day, which makes it interestering.
cons: Cintas does not assist professionals with a career plan. Once you are hired you have no idea of where your salary falls for the position that you hold. They appear to only promote partners who bragg abut thier accomplishments.

review_title: Not the worst place in the world to work
pros:
- Well Respected Company
- Decent Salary Plans
- Benefits are on par with other Fortune 500 companies
- Job security
cons:
-  Male Dominated and very political
-  Does not invest in technology at all
-  Very conservative corporate culture
-  There is a lot of buzz about development, but very few training opportunities

review_title: A company that you can grow in with hard work, but they can be cheap
pros: There is a chance to move up if you have the qualifications and show that you can lead and make good decisions. You also learn from the ground up which give you a better appreciation for lower positions and thus making you a better manager if given the chance.
cons: Working the in plant is not something anyone wants to do, but its a have to, to learn about the lower positions. Company cuts it cost, but with that, the workers suffer.

pros: Cintas really cares about each employee, not just the bottom line.  The sense of community in the workplace is truly unique and there is a strong bond amongst the team.
cons: Long hours and a never ending list of things that need to be done; one could literally work non-stop.  Just as with any large company, there are all sorts of tasks competing for your time.  One must have the ability to manage their own schedule and calendar in order to get it all in.

review_title: Good place to work until you get tired of the push for more and more.
pros: Great Benefits, decent pay depending on route, great training in areas that will help your resume ie; First Aid, CPR, Hazcom, etc...
cons: Very demanding as far as goals; always pushing the bar higher and higher to a point where it seems greedy. Puts shareholders and profits above employees - read their mission statement. Not all routes are created equal and no pay raise unless you're hitting goals which are skewed for profits.

review_title: Good Company with no place to go.
job_title: First Aid & Safety Service Sales Representative in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Cintas is a reliable place to work with a good and strong culture.
cons: No place to go beyond your current position. If your looking to move up this is not place for you. Their are very few opportunities and if you want to move within the company you need to patient very patient.

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Atlanta, GA
pros:
Has good health, dental, and vision insurance plans
Gives weekly pay checks
Base pay, route volume, catalog commish, random product add contest bonus, monthly retention bonus
cons:
Long hours, poor employee recognition, no support, high pricing for customers, uncomfortable working conditions 100+ degrees poor maintenance, no growth with favoritism not the right candidiant, have to keep track of your own pay to make sure you get paid on bonuses, sales leads, adds, hours, well your pay in overall
Hypocritical management

pros: Good training.  4 ten hour days is nice (if really 10 hours). good benefits.  Overall I think it is a good company - especially the higher you move up.
cons:
It all depends on the route you get - the routes can be way to long.
You can have a very bad vehicle.
Where I was a uniform route is way better than a facility route.

pros:
Very friendly, relaxed, and fun interview environment.
They want to make sure you work in the geographical area you prefer.
cons:
They expect you to know who they are, what they do, and what you are interested on.
They expect you to drive a van and make deliveries.

review_title: Cintas gives you the tools and knowledge for you to be successful.
pros:
Plenty of advancement opportunity for those who want to excel. 

Competitive pay

4 day work weeks w/ no weekends

Plenty of perks for those that meet and exceed quotas 

Energy, enthusiasm and positive vibes from all employees
cons:
Routes are commission based, eventually you Plato and aren't compensated very well for all that extra work. 

You are held accountable for somethings you have no little to no control over.

job_title: Mid-Market Account Manager in Mason, OH
pros: Plenty of room to grow in this company with really beneficial training and development courses offered.
cons: Over worked with hard deadlines. I worked before work, during work, during lunch and after work. I truly believe this is a great company with the hardest working people I have ever worked with but they do not pay employees well for the work they are putting in compared to other companies.

pros: I don't have anything they need to pay more money for what they went you to do
cons: For what they went you to do as your job they don't pay and more you do than they went you to do more . They went you to rush to get more done and if you get hurt or have a accident than they write you up so it makes them look good and they make up rules as they go long and they tell you that you can move up then they lie to you and if you go to the management about anything they found away for you not to move up

review_title: Good people, good pay, sales grind
pros: I work with some great people and enjoy the camaraderie. If you really hustle, you can make a great income.
cons: I drove almost 40k miles in one year and it was truly a grind of door to door sales. The harder you work and more time you put in, the more money you make though.

job_title: Production Supervisor in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: Opportunities for advancement and growth one you prove yourself.  Great healthcare benefits.  It seems like they really take care of their own and if you are on the "in" then you are good.
cons: We are in a low paying industry in general.  Sometimes words we use like "spartan" and "frugal" can be regarded as "cheap".  It also seems like some are pigeon - holed into their specific areas or fields.

pros: Cintas is a great company, a Fortune 500 Company and has many chances to move upward.  They were one of the only companies in the US to have continuous growth for 29 years.
cons: Some of the managers do not know what they are doing.  They push work to others to mask this and do a decent job of masking it.  Some people also are promoted without merit.

review_title: Not a good place to work for recent college grads
pros: Friendly office environment.  Room to advance.  Great benefits.  Good people.  Multiple locations around the country.  4 day work weeks for certain Service Sales Representatives.
cons: Terrible offices/ p;ants.  Certain partners are treated way better than partners in other business units within Cintas.  Working 60 hour weeks for uncompetitive pay.

review_title: A good company in the beginning.
pros: Most people that work for Cintas are great.They work very hard to earn their pay.
cons:
Cintas plays games with salary and compensations, especially with the older workers. If Cintas is a short term situation for you, then it could work on a temporary basis otherwise you should definetly look elsewhere. Corporate greed is rampant, at the expense of hard working employees. I would never recommend this company to anyone seeking a place of employment with honesty and integrity. 

.

review_title: Get your experience and move on! This company is a resume builder.
pros: Competitive compensation for first 2 years of outside sales
cons:
Horribly outdated systems and software
You will be asked to perform a million and one other jobs than what your title says
Reps don't play on same playing field
Underperforming reps are promoted as opposed to let go creating an inept management structure
Comp plan changes every single year which greatly reflects company woes
They would prefer drones who drink the 'Company Culture' Kool-Aid as opposed to recognizing talent worth holding onto
Competing score cards across divisions

pros: The company hires and train young individuals right out of college. They are trained the Cintas way and culture. Cintas goes above and beyond to keep their employee happy, safe and engaged.
cons: Cintas is very reluctant to spend money to reward and show appreciation to their employees and as well as on equipment and facility repairs. Managers are trained the Cintas way, since they were hired young and had no other company management style, which made it very hard to communicate with.

pros: management is very helpful and they try hard to give us good working conditions. pay is good if you work. benefits are cheap and the partner perks program is good. i like my coworkers and the room for opportunity
cons: management struggles to keep up with work load but they never give up. they have parties for us every month and try to tell us about what's going on in the location

job_title: Territory Account Representative in Houston, TX
pros:
Product offerings are the best in the industry, and normally not the cheapest, however, Cintas has the best service representatives in the industry.

Cintas has different divisions so cross selling opportunities are nice.
cons:
for uniform sales: a lot of moving parts when installing the sale - you must be an organized person.

for facility services: easy money, Cintas is the only company that offers bold color dispensers.  you gotta hustle to be successful in this role.

pros: Good compensation, great culture, everyone is treated with respect.  A lot of opportunity for growth.  They're willing to invest in their partners to ensure they have the training that they need.
cons: Limited training on computer software makes it difficult to navigate sites at first, but eventually you'll catch on.

pros:
- Great place for someone who likes to work hard and get paid for it
- Solid training programs to help employees succeed
- Positive work environment for those that put forth the effort
cons:
- Not a place to work if you do not have a strong work ethic
- Company still has issues with being a good ol' boys club where it's who you're friends with that determines promotions and the length of your career
- Work/Life balance is always a challenge

pros: They are an employer. They have jobs to offer.
cons: Don't care about their people. Run away if you're thinking of working for them! They only want your time, expect outrageous demands, and you will have nothing to show for it when you're done. 100% political focus on promotions and growth. They improve the bottom line each fiscal year by making bonuses for their front line employees more and more difficult to attain. Easy money for the fat cats up top! They profess to care about their customers, but only if that customer is big $$$. Small business owners, don't do business with Cintas! Prospective employees: They want to be your only concern in life!

pros:
Cintas is able to get some of the best people out there to work from them. Very meticulous hiring process. Truly promotes from within. 

Company is growing like never before.

Making HUGE advancements in technology. 

Car package with fuel and insurance.
cons:
You are not allowed to do any work between the hours of (when I left) 7:30am till 5:30pm. You are supposed to be out selling, that is it. If you show up to the plant senior management will ask why you are there and say "why aren't you out selling." Very discouraging work environment. 

You are not allowed to have facial hair. Suit and tie are required every day. I was there for 2 short years and in those 2 short years my entire team turned over including the manager. Everyone either left, was fired, or demoted. 

You have the same number to hit as every location in the country so you have these  booming cities (Nashville, Austin, Raleigh) where reps are hitting goals with their eyes closed. Meanwhile struggling cities / rural America are left behind and told to "find a way" if they cannot hit the number. However managers have different goals to hit are held to different standard than the reps. 

I don't think anyone in senior management ever took a microeconomics class. 

Your PTO is questioned if you are behind on your number. (Last year 4 FS reps 2 MDRs 0 Uniform hit presidents club in my market), so basically everyone was behind on their number).

Senior management has no idea how to forecast year over year. If your team is supposed to sell $1,000,000 but only sells $500,000, instead of adjusting the following year to make the goal realistic, they will will say we are raising it by 10% and tacking on the $500,000 we missed last year so the new goal is $1.6million. Then they fall even shorter and more people leave or are fired.

Don't ever, ever, ever question management's ways. The second you do that you have a red mark on your name. Don't ever suggest anything, don't ever question anything, don't ever ask why certain things are done certain ways. Put your head down, say yes sir, yes m'am and go to work.

review_title: Your working for a company that ACTUALLY cares about their employees.
job_title: Garment Sorter in Crown Point, IN
pros: So many things. Full time, wonderful benefits, 401k,retirement, PTO days, relaxed and easygoing environment. Weekends off, set schedule, paid holidays, they’re always feeding you. If you come on the weekends for OT they always provide breakfast and lunch.
cons: The pay could be better, and you get stuck working in one section. Room to move up in the company is a little difficult.

pros: I was recruited out of WSU in 2019. Nobody grows up and thinks they will end up in the laundry industry after college, but Cintas has been incredible! Cintas offers an exceptional culture, a well paying jungle gym career path, and strong business ethics.
cons: The laundry industry is hard work! It is a service industry, and Cintas is the best in the business. In order to justify our higher prices, we emphasize strong work ethic, delivering the best quality, and doing anything for our customers. Be ready to GRIND.

pros: Promotional opportunities, fast paced work environment, employees that really care about one another, competitive pay and benefits, good working relationship between management and employees.
cons: Not many downsides.  There is no tuition reimbursement program, but they do offer a lot of internal training.  Eventually, you reach a point where to advance, you need to relocate or spend time in the corporate office.

pros:
-Service Rep. co-workers
-Good pay and good benefits.
-Plenty of overtime.
-4 day work week. MOSTLY optional Fridays.
cons:
-Micro-managers.
-No paid holidays for Service Reps.
-Almost non-existent fleet maintenance
- The company makes it impossible to get a hold of H.R. when you need them (but they're there for termination!). Everything is centralized through an 800 number outsourced to India.

pros: I learned a great deal about how much I could handle. The company is always growing so its a pretty stable job.
cons: Corporate to a fault. Micro Managed but with no help. Everyone is around is telling you need to do more but no one can be bothered if you have a problem. The amount of work is no where near  comparable to the low rate of pay.

pros: Coworkers were great to have around, all tried to help each other
cons: Management was sub par especially after the US taking over the Canadian site as the departments weren't doing well and ended up firing almost all management. They left one manger employed for the entire office; unorganized, not given the right resources to succeed yet reprimanded for not doing certain tasks we knew nothing about. Management talked down to anyone they didn't particularly like and disclosed information that was meant to be private. HR got fired for disclosing private information as well.

job_title: Sales Representative in Fort Worth, TX
pros: Great training, own your schedule which can be a good and bad thing depending on your drive as a sales person. Room for growth.
cons: Pressure cooker. Weekly numbers can be stressful but what sales job doesn’t have goals/expectations.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Everett, WA
pros: Cintas is respectful to each employees personal life and family. It has been a wonderful experience.  Management is supportive and caring.  There is room for growth and opportunites to a certain degree depending on if this is the field of work you enjoy.  Benefits are great and vacation/time off is more than fair.  I would recommend Cintas as an employer to anyone looking for a stable, family friendly company to work for.
cons:
Limited room for growth
Limited additional training and education

review_title: Don't go to Cintas if you are not prepared to cold call and hunt 100% of the time
pros:
Make own schedule
Not too much required office time
Easy paperwork
Excellent training program
Great line of service and products to sell
cons:
Very low commission structure vs other sales divisions
No residual sales
No relationship selling
Ability to "manage" is dependent upon making "presidents club" which doesn't automatically make someone management material.

review_title: Good place to start your IT career.
pros: Excellent health benefits.  Good people in the trenches.  Good work life balance - if you have the right manager.  Definitely a small company feel within the IT department.
cons: One of the few IT departments still clinging to business attire.  Management viewed as a club that hires/promotes conformists.  IT department very conservative.  Not much in the way of "cutting edge" technology.

review_title: Hard work, low pay, little option to grow within company, worked there for 8 years!!!!!
job_title: Facility Services Sales Representative in Chicago, IL
pros: Compensate employees through selling accounts, good health befits that you pay for
cons: VERY SEXIST COMPANY, All WHITE MALE PROMOTED, terrible training, lack of communication, operation failures regularly, expectations without pay, expected to work on weekends in order to be a top seller.

pros: weekly pay, good commission structure for top performers, lot of freedom if you perform, car package best I have seen in an outside sales role, they give enough time to people to perform
cons: no accountability for service or plant partners, constant battle with plant and service to get things done, can be frustrating when territory is saturated

pros: Most positions within the company have set, steady hours (you'll get your 40). The benefits are good; Healthcare, 401k contributions, profit sharing.
cons: If you're on the production side of the business pay is rather of low. There is little to no career development, unless you're in the Manage Trainee program with requires a bachelor's degree. No tuition assistance.

pros: You have the ability to earn what a great living with the company.  The training is very helpful stick to the play book and good things will happen.
cons: They don't train the managers as well as they train the reps.  Focus on teaching the managers so that you have a better line of communication.

pros: Great culture, decent base pay
cons: Expected to do a significant amount of work outside of business hours. 8-5 in the field then all paperwork and additional training after initial hire date is to be done before or after business hours. If you have a family or value your free time this may not be the company for you.

pros: Great culture, some adhere to it, others clearly do not. Training upon request, friendly environment, opendoor policy. Most SSR's & plant employees really are the heart, soul & blood that runs through the powerhouse veins, they keep everything afloat truley, a lot of dedication there. Decent pay.
cons: Long hours, laborous work. Management distinctively seperates themselves by overworking & overlooking.  Fleet rarely all funtional, making working conditions vastly amplified in difficulty.

job_title: Service Sales Representative in Bossier City, LA
pros: The people I work with at cintas are very good people.  The benefits are very good as far as the health insurance and 401k.
cons: Cintas is the cheapest company ever.  You would think that a company this big would reward their best and brightest with raises and incentives, but no.

pros: The corporate culture and management style are friendly and put employees first in most cases. The opportunity for advancement is there for those willing to put in the hours.
cons: Pay is in the 40% range for similar positions and the level of commitment required is borderline cultish. There is a fine line between the "spartan approach to business" and being cheap and Cintas flirts with over the top cheap.

pros: Paid holidays and weekends off, decent medical benefits if you have family to take care of. Monthly events/lunches coordinated by HR.
cons: Favoritism between management and other employees, lack of respect between some of the drivers and the plant personnel. Raises are minimal and downright insulting.

review_title: Good and Bad depending on view
pros:
Stable company that continues to bring in more business opportunity
Decent Pay
Good benefits
cons:
Male dominated
women are treated and spoken to as if we were playing football instead of in an office setting.
no upward mobility
Culture that built the company no longer exists

review_title: It's an ok company, certainly better than some
pros: It's obviously a large public company, so you have stable employment, decent benefits, approachable management and opportunity for growth (which depends on your talents).
cons: It's shareholder oriented and their goal is to reduce liabilities as much as possible. There's a multitude of trainings that everyone has to go through on regular basis which is an enormous waste of resources, because employees are required to train on unrelated to them subjects.

pros: 4-day work week. You have an opportunity to grow your route. I like the fact that I do not have someone over my shoulder while I am working.
cons: Work many hours. Mostly 45-50 hours in 4 days. No work-life balance. As an SSR, there are not many ways that you can be promoted unless you work for the company over 5 years.

pros: Health insurance is good, dental/vision are fair. You get a paycheck weekly.  Many on here seem to like this company but some are so easily brainwashed.
cons:
Work/life balance: Most of the time, you will not have a life except your life at work. Overtime is obligatory. No appreciation for the overtime whatsoever except the slight increase in your paycheck. 

Culture/values: Unethical to say the least. No room for growth unless you are a friend, family member or butt kisser. Hard workers who don't fit into one of these categories have very little hope of advancement. Mother and daughter work in the same office. Two sisters work in the same office. 

Overall: sucks!

pros: A company with great opportunity for those who are smart, loyal, and love to work!  The compensation and benefits are great!
cons: One element of Cintas culture is competitive urgency!  If you posses the ability to attend to every detail of your business with urgency, enthusiasm, and professionalism this is the career for you.  Those who are not detail oriented will struggle.

pros: Good company to work for. They take care of their employees and the branch I worked at worked 4 10 hour shifts so 3 day weekend is always nice.
cons: Where I worked the compensation was not where I needed it to be. It wasn't bad and you could get by, there was a lot more potential outside of the company.
